These were very pretty but arrived much smaller then I anticipated. I bought them for a 14 year old girl for Christmas and suspect they may be more intended for someone maybe 8-10.

If this is the original formula for the After Bath Splash, it is watered down with something. It almost smells right - but not really. I have left the top off in hopes that evaporation will condense it down to the right fragrance. I used this product from 1960 to 2008-ish (when I could no longer find it), so I certainly know what I'm talking about. I would rather pay more for it and get the real thing.

Let's face it: anyone who buys from Jason, a company whose logo says "Pure, Natural & Organic", is doing so because they don't want to put on their skin the toxins found in most commercial skin care products. I really like the texture and feel of Jason products and I was happily using several of them when I received an email newsletter which said that Organic Consumers Association had recently tested 100 "Organic" or "Natural" products for contamination with 1,4 dioxane, a carcinogen that often results from the manufacturing process of PEG, polyethylene, Oxynol and ingredients ending with "eth". More than half of these "organic" products had 1,4 dioxane. Unfortunately, Jason is one of them. The ingredients list for Jason Lifting Eye Creme are better than most, which is why I didn't give them the poorest rating. There are no parabens or other known carcinogens, but they have fallen down by the inclusion of one ingredient, Ceteareth-20. While the FDA has never set a limit for 1,4 dioxane content and it's possible Ceteareth can be in a skin product without contamination, the fact that some Jason products are contaminated makes me suspicious that they lack the kind of quality control which would prevent it. You're better off using this eye cream than something from your local drug store or department store, but there are products out there that are clear of 1,4 dioxane. Look for 100% certified USDA organic products, because no certified organic products were found to be contaminated.
Because the fragrance only lasts about three hours or maybe four. I've tried it in the past so, I decided to try it again because I needed some perfume.
Was expecting a larger diameter mirror - was very disappointed to receive a small 3" mirror - returned it. Nothing wrong w/mirror - just not what I needed.

Like most Davidoff scents I have tried this one seems to be fleeting. It does not last longer than an hour or two on me. This is a shame because I love the way it smells. Very clean, appropriately masculine and quite refreshing.
This nail polish is very thin and goes on extremely sheer. You need at least 4 coats to make it opaque and to get the color you want.

Just a note that there are lots of nylon posts in the bristles and those posts aren't exactly smooth. If you have lots and lots of hair, I can see this being a plus, but if you have thinning hair of any kind, I'd avoid this brush and stick with one having 100% bristles.

I bought this before vacation "in case of a sunburn". Well, the burn happened but the spray didn't help. It feels good going on, but the relief is temporary and did not provide the moisture my skin needed. When you look at the ingredients #3 is alcohol...not such a good thing for burned, dehydrated skin. We ended up buying an aloe gel at the gift shop and I feel much better!

This baby shampoo performed well: good lather, cleaned the hair well, didn't irritate our eyes, and smelled good. Although I was satisfied with the results of my Test Drive, I wasn't overly impressed with the product and wouldn't switch from my normal brand.
It doesn't live up to the Trind name but I still use it. I've have others that cost about the same but costs less.

The good news is that this is a great fragrance for guys over 30. I found it years ago in a U.S. department store. The name refers to an Italian tennis star. While the company that makes toiletries and clothing that uses his name is still in business, this fragrance is no longer manufactured. That's the bad news. The replacement is a bit too strong for my taste. I was very pleased with the speed and condition of the bottles I ordered as well as the price.

It was evident to me in the opening chapter that this book would not be successful in making the case for improving relationships by setting "boundaries". Although it succeeds in overusing the term "boundary", it fails at improving relationships.The most critical chapter of the book, on Boundaries and God (Chapt. 13), should have been the crux of the entire book. God is the author of relationships, thus He is the authority on how to improve our relationships. This chapter should have clearly and concisely presented the Gospel message of how a Holy God restores humanity to himself by atoning our sins for His Son's blood on the cross. Only after restoration of our relationship to God, may we even have a hope at healthy relationships with others.Not only should the book have opened with this chapter, it completely loses credibility by omitting the most crucial part of our existence- we are all sinners, who sinned against a Holy God. It states "the main reason loving God and our neighbor is difficult is because of boundary problems- problems of responsibility". Completely false!In an effort to maintain continuity in their excessive use of "boundarylessness", the authors irresponsibly infer that we have difficulty loving God and others simply because we don't know or exercise our boundaries; thus removing sin out of the picture. The Bible is explicitly clear that we can not nor ever will be able to love God or one another because God is love and the source of love. Through sin we are separated from Him until we are reconciled through repentance and trust in Jesus' atoning blood.The authors say "But at the same time, [God] does not rescue us; he wants us to work it out for our own good". The Bible says "For by grace are you saved through faith; and that not of yourselves. It is the gift of God. Not of works, lest any man should boast" (Ephesians 2:8-9). Without the presence of God's Holy Spirit, there is no power, let alone desire innately in any of us to love God or one another. The Holy Spirit is a gift to the believer after salvation. There is no mention throughout this entire book of the ministry of the Holy Spirit. Scripture tells us no one does good. No, not one (Romans 3:10). Apart from Christ, we do not have the capacity to "change for our own good and [God's] glory. Our deeds are but filthy rags to Him (Isaiah 64:6).On a positive note, the story about Jerry, the adulterer, involved confession and repentance. The Bible tells us these kinds of gestures honor God and lead to restoration of relationship with Him. Repentance must also be followed up with trust in Jesus Christ. Unfortunately, the authors cram this authentic example into a "boundary" box.Another major failure is that the authors absolutely neglect God's holiness. They boil his character down to just another human relationship. This is a distorted view of how great God is and how significant a relationship with Him is. He is the Creator and is worthy to be revered as such. He is not our pal who simply desires us to hang with him every once in a while.The authors state that "The basic problem in human relationship is that of freedom". Wrong! The Bible tells us the basic problem in any relationship is sin. Adam did not fall from fellowship with God because of freedom. The Fall occurred because of sin. That's theology 101.In the last section of the chapter, the authors give us their opinions of what they think the gospel is, but never proclaim the Gospel message as told by the Scriptures. In 302 pages, they manage to support their nauseating premise on how defining boundaries will improve our relationships, and never once present the Good News. All Christians are instructed to share the Good News where ever we go. True change in any relationship begins with the Good News of Jesus Christ dying to save sinners. Apart from Christ we have no life at all. We are walking dead men.

All the glowing reviews were right! This is the richest lotion I think I've ever used, but it also absorbs into the skin quickly and leaves my skin feeling very soft. My daughter--who usually dislikes body lotion because of the slippery feeling some of them leave on your skin for a few minutes--really loves this. I wish the vanilla smell lasted longer, but I guess it's hard to have something fast-absoring and with a lasting fragrance.

After Burts Bee's was purchased by Clorox -- i needed to find a new organic/cruelty free product. The Suki facial toner works very well! It smells wonderful without smelling perfume-y. Very gentle and refreshing on the skin. My skin feels fresh and hydrated. I spritz it on before bed and in the morning. I would recommend this product.

I really liked this product but didn't like that it seems to be something you only use once. As soon as I put it in the tub it started to melt very quickly. That seems a bit extreme for the price of it. Much smaller ones should be made and in packs so that you can have one to put in the tub when you want to and it wouldn't be too much. I think one whole large one is too much for one bath. There also should be instructions with their products. I noticed a lot of their items do not have any.
Vendor accuses me of lying about never receiveing product. According to them: THE CUSTOMER'S ALWAYS WRONG!~

Tried the shampoo for four months, then also tried the expensive hair and scalp lotion with booster from Kevis. It did nothing to stop hair loss. Discontinued use of the after several months when persistent headaches began to follow each application of the hair and scalp lotion with booster.

This scent seems to have been a bit more offensive than the last one we tried, but it's not strong enough for a dedicated nail biter. I had optomistic hopes for this product based on the reviews of other users, but it did not turn out to be effective for my daughter's nailbiting problem. She said it tasted gross, but not bad enough for her to keep her fingers out of his mouth. I've tried other similar products that also were not effective but maybe it is good for others.

Yes, Yes! Horray! The day has finally come. I've found a facial cleanser I never want to give up. Like many i've tried everything that's come out, wasting a lot of money in the process. I gave up and went to a dermatologist after trying to battle occasional breakouts, combination skin ( or i think that's what it is. . .it's oily, it's dry,... it's everything thrown together), and facewashes that left my face feeling tight. This is what she gave me. She uses it and the Neutragena Moisture with SPF 15...and that's it. Oh, and Aveno lotion on the rest of her body. No other products. No wrinkle cream. No eye cream. Nothing.So, I pitched everything else and my skin's so much happier. It's been almost a year and i'll never switch again. I hope this saves someone a lot of frustration.

The Iconic Frostbite is all over the nail blogs as the "it" color.. frosty high luster medium blue with fire within.Well.. I don't know why but this bottle I got from here was dark.. more like a slightly shimmery navy. Not pretty on my olive skin. I was expecting the color in the blogs.. a vibrant beautiful light Royal blue.. instead.. it is quite dark.. with a slight shimmer if you put your hand in the sun... just looks like Navy cream polish...I don't know if the formula is different.. I don't know if this is a second? I don't know if the blogs lie... but you know mailing it back would just cost more than the whole thing is worth.I guess.. if you are looking for the Iconic Blue in the Blogs.. try buying in person and try on...Just looked too dark.. and was totally not what I expected.. very sad...
Helps keep in my red color hair I'm satisfied with my purchase and I was recommended by a friend to give it a try.

I have bought this product for years from my salon. I thought I would buy it online to save a trip to my salon. Considering how often I use this product, I noticed right away that the color was off. Then when I used it, it was obvious that the product was fake considering the consistency was very different. Finally when I used it, my hair was full of knots and unusually dry. I'm disappointed that I bought two bottles. Please, please be aware that Deal Seakers is selling FAKE Bumble and Bumble products! Unacceptable.

Everyone has different hair, so shampoo and conditioner are very personal things. I have long, shiny hair that is prone to split ends. My hair waves when it is humid. My scalp is oily. I wash my hair everyday. This product has been decent for me (shampoo is pretty good) but this smells musty and gross! I've noticed the same problem withDove Damage Therapy Cool Moisture Conditioner, 25.4 Ounce (Pack of 2), which used to smell good and work a lot better. I never used this line with the original formulation, so I can't say for sure, but I suspect that this conditioner used to work a lot better too because the Cool Moisture Conditioner is just the same product (it has the same ingredients) with a different fragrance thrown in. Otherwise, this conditions fine, and leaves my hair smooth. It's nothing special, but good for the price. Usually I pick between this, Aussie, or Pantene, depending on which one is the cheapest at the time. This is not to be confused with Dove's Damage Therapy Intensive Repair line (Dove Damage Therapy Intensive Repair Shampoo, 25.4 Ounce (Pack of 2)), which I once accidentally bought instead of this and had to give to my mother because it REALLY doesn't work for my hair.

This is heavy and makes my hands sticky when applying it. Nioxin is for fine and/or thinning hair. This doesn't "shine" it just takes the fluff out of my hair and makes it lay flat. Not at all what I was expecting. In general, I love their products, have been using them for years.. but will never order this again.
was promised a replacement, they requested my address to send a replacement but even after my follow-up never got the replacement.

I use this gel with B5 design Gel by Aubrey it creates a balance add the Giovanni first then the other Love this stuff and its chemical Free!!!
this is fake paco xs . the bottle and sticker is not the real one!! smell right but doesn't last long. very up set to order

This shampoo replaced a wonderful Pantene product that helped hold the color red and enhanced it. This one is the one that is available so I am stuck. It cleans my hair beautifully but does not enrich the color as the previous product did so well.
I cannot STAND the smell of this. I love the smell of coconut....but this is not it. Overpowering and just flat rank.

If you use this product right after a hot shower, it will sting and burn! oww!I didn't notice much results with the use of this product. It didn't seem to make my blemishes go away any faster, although I do feel it kept them under control.I recommend getting the "Desert Essence" Tea Tree Oil instead. Put a few drops on a cotton pad with witch hazel, and use it all over your face 2 or more times a day. It doesn't sting and helps blemishes heal faster. I actually have the 1.7 oz spray of horizion, thank goodness. Another scent that was short lived for guy laroche, whos best known scent is Drakkar. This scent reminds me at times of an older womans overpowering perfume, or the bad scent of original polo. It has a more mossy smell, and at time I swear it can smell like a locker room, not cool. This item is good gift choice. But there is no discount at Amazon. I could have bought it for the same price at Calvin kliene store in the outlet mall. I would suggest to check out the product at the local mall before buying at Amazon.

its a great conditioning lotion. i like it better than the other leading brand of hair lotions

I wear short dark nails now but I never forgot where it all started for me, with Essie Marshmallow. Best white polish ever.

I still get a bit stressed sometimes, thinking I might break it, but I think that is just me being paranoid. So basically it is a good product, but i don't think i would pick it again.

It turned out to be nothing like described. The jaws do NOT open wide enough to handle thick long nails. There was no sharp clipping. My nails were completely mangled...shredded, ruining several pairs of socks. The grip is comfortable, but what good is that if it doesn't perform to specifications?

This shampoo sounds like it might be biodegradable and thus environmentally safe to use when camping. I can't tell from the ingredients, but if someone knows, please add a review because I would love to use this instead of the age-old camping shampoo that makes hair feel like felt.

I am asian and my hair is naturally black and i've been using this brand from the Philippines and it works. but somehow, when i tried the US brand, it didn't work on me. maybe the problem is this color or asian hairs are thicker than american.
I look like a pixie every time I put this stuff on my face... it's just too micro-sparkly for me.
I did not like this. I'm sensitive to perfumes and the fragrance in this moisturizer was too strong for me.

My husband has a skin condition on his hands which causes costant redness, peeling and cracking. We've tried everything natural and holistic (even oral Flax oil) and nothing seemed to work with any dependability for very long. I had a sample jar of the Beesway Hand Creme in a sample package and rubbed it on his hands one night to see what it would do. He continued doing this for 2 nights and on the third day proclaimed "this stuff works!" His hands were softer, the cracking had stopped and it appears like his hands are healing. I bought him some cotton gloves to wear at night to see if would help the creme penetrate even further. Anyhow take it from us THIS STUFF WORKS. And it isn't even winter yet!!
Can't understand why we can't get this stuff sent to a Military APO in Germany. Had to send to family to forward to us at an extra expense. Not Good!!!!

This is an excellent line of products that are paraben free! I can feel this eye serum tightning the skin around my eyes, right when I put it on. If it works for women over 40, then it should work for women in their 30s too! I feel good about supporting a women owned company that uses only natural ingredients!

I always use Paul Mitchell's Tea Tree Shampoo. I saw this and it is organic, so I thought I would try it. I don't think it works as well. It doesn't make your scalp tingle at all either. I think it doesn't have enough tea tree oil in it. I wouldn't buy it again but it works alright.

I decided to keep this fragrance for those once-in-a-while occasions when I want something different. It is both sharp and sweet, almost like air fresheners or kids scents, I can't be taken seriously wearing this. But it is very happy and youthful, so maybe a good Friday fragrance... Not totally me, I think I will stick to more sophisticated perfume houses in the future, Bvlgari or Hermes...
I bought several items from this line at the mall. I like them a lot but was VERY sorry I bought them at the mall since the Amazon prices are WAY better!

Well, the short answer is that Robathol is just too oily for me. To be a bit more specific, no matter how well you rinse, there is still an oily feel which some might like, but is not for me. I really wanted to like it as it was highly recommended to me by a friend who likes the product very much.
The Duo saves me money since me and my stepdaughter both use this product and it seems to go a long way. I also use other Pureology products.

When I ordered this product for a Christmas gift for my niece, I didn't understand that it came with hand cream. It was a very pleasant surprise when it arrived. Amazon had the best price and ordering from them is always so very, very easy. I recommend this product and Amazon!!!

I got this lotion to help with my acne. I am 30 and have had moderate to severe acne since my early teens. It has worsened in recent years. I'd heard good things about glycolic acid as a really thorough exfoliator, which can help cut down on acne. I thought, for $10, I had nothing to lose by trying it. After washing with a mild non-soap cleanser, I put on the AHA Enhanced Lotion before bed and took my niacin and zinc supplements. I expected it would take a couple of weeks before I saw a measurable difference in my skin, if any; either that, or I'd react poorly to it and would wake up with a bad breakout.To my surprise, after ONE USE my skin was noticeably improved. I woke the next morning and stared in amazement at my face in the mirror -- not only were all my acne spots smaller and MUCH less inflamed than when I'd gone to bed, but my skin had an overall healthy glow to it that is has literally never, ever had before, except perhaps when I was a very young child. The dark red scars all over my cheeks from years' worth of bad breakouts were noticeably lighter. After one use. I was really amazed and couldn't believe the results -- I had to take pictures of myself and compare them to older pictures to be sure I wasn't crazy (I wasn't!).I've now been using AHA Enhanced nightly for about a month. In that time, my skin has been closer to 100% clear than I ever dreamed it could be. It's not totally blemish-free, but the zits I do have are tiny, infrequent, and clear within a day or two (I should note, the supplements I'm taking also have had a noticeable effect, noted before I started using this lotion, so I can't say that my acne success is 100% because of AHA...but it's most definitely helped!) I have also noticed a visible reduction in the fine lines around my eyes. No, this lotion will not make your lines go away entirely, but I have been happy to note that it seems to have turned back the clock on my skin by five years or so. :) I'm hoping that continued use will smooth out the deeper line on my forehead (at least I only have one!) and help prevent more from forming.In addition to using it on my face, I've been using it on my shoulders and back to help clear up my body breakouts. there, too, it's done a remarkable job of reducing the amount of time my spots stick around, reducing redness, and reducing size.I am going to start using the lotion on my entire body because I am enjoying the soft texture and glowing appearance of my face and neck so much.I normally have very sensitive skin and I notice hardly any stinging when using this lotion. It goes away within a couple of minutes.The only drawbacks for me have been the smell -- many people have remarked that this lotion is scent-free, but it does have a noticeably unpleasant odor in my opinion. However, that goes away quickly as the lotion sinks into your skin. This lotion also does such a great job of exfoliating that I've had little flakes form on my face -- something that never ever happened to me before using, since I never could exfoliate well enough before this lotion to make a difference with my acne. But a few quick checks in the mirror daily keep facial flakes from becoming too numerous.I'll be an AHA user for life! This is great stuff!!

Purchased this for a family member after hearing great things. It has lived up to the hype. Leaves the hair softer and more manageable than all the other dryers tried over the years. It is also relatively quieter so you don't need earplugs. Since then have purchased another for a different family member.
This is a great smelling cologne for me. I love it! The price was great too.

delicious smell. a great summery alternative for those of us who like the gingerbread man scrub. the scub is makes me feel super smooth without leaving an oily feel on the skin like other scrubs i've used before.
It goes on really well hardly any streaking. Had to apply 3 coats but it's fine, doesn't take up that much time. China glaze shocking pink is too cute :)

I take this traveling with me in case I get any cuts or scrapes. It has come in very hand a few times, and heals my hand. There is no the burning sensation of alcohol or hydrogen peroxide, so you know its gentler on the body.

I got this product because my skin was getting really dry from the winter weather. I didn't think I needed a night cream yet so I got this to hydrate my skin at night.This product left the strangest sticky residue on my face. I really do not like that at all. I will finish this particular product and not ever buy this hydrating cream again. I use Olay's daily moisturizer and I love that product. This one, just is not working for me.
It has good magnification but is smaller than I thought. It is ok but i would not buy it again.
Purchased about 6 1/2 months ago and the spring just went out on it so it will not close to hold the hair.

I bought this planning on using it on a particularly bad spot of Psoriasis on my scalp. It does seem to help, but the messiness outweighs the usefulness of this product to some degree. I use it directly out of the shower before bed and always shower in the morning. I can't imagine leaving it in during the day since it has such a powerful fragrence and ends up matting the hair after it dries. I'm still undecided on whether or not I'll buy again since the price of this product is so low.

I ordered this product because I read other reviews claiming that it was "the best dry shampoo." It was a great price, under $5 and I was very excited to get it.The product came quickly and I tried it immediately. But was unpleased with the results. This product turned my hair white [my hair is dark blonde/light brown]and although the white color brushed out easily, it really didn't do anything for it. It didn't make it look clean or shiny as it claimed it did.Basically, I wasted $5 to find out this product doesn't work. I'd be interested in trying another one, though I hope it works next time.

It's a very light, very forgettable fragrance. Nothing distinct about it that would inspire one to choose it as their "signature fragrance." I got it for a birthday gift and I doubt I will ever be wearing it. It fades off my skin after about 30 minutes (I usually keep perfume scents very well). Maybe I will spray my linens with it because it IS a pleasant scent.

They sent a bottle half the size as discribed. They have done nothing to correct the mistake!!!!! I have emailed them over a month ago and have been waiting patiently for another bottle to be sent. I've emailed twice since then and have gotten 0 responses. Complete rip off!!!!

Ive had this blow dryer for about a 1 1/2 and it still works fine. Im not a fan personally: I would like if it weighed a little less, Im a hairdresser and on my feet all day. The cord is short, maybe its a long enough for personal use, not in a salon! It gets the job done, but Ive learned to research a little harder in the future.

I received this color as a gift and was excited at the bright color. When I applied this, I soon realized that it was thin and dried matte. :( Not only this, but after a few coats there were streaks and you could still see my nail. Darn, the color is still nice but only a decent quality.

The color is pretty and it is definitely neon but you will need around 4 coats to make it look true to the color in the bottle or you will need to use a white base color to make the color pop. I gave it a 3 because it is a bit sheer and you have to layer it on to get it to look opaque.

Great product; moisturizes very well. We live in Southern California where the humidity can drop to 12% when the Santa Ana winds blow. This is the perfect remedy for those days. It lasts all day, and eliminates the need for lotion after the shower. However; wow the scent is way too strong. I hate to use it before bed as it just clings. If anyone from Dove reads these reviews - please, please consider reducing the level of the scent and/or replacing it with something mild like the old original Dove bar soap scent.

I purchased this product because Burt's products are usually great. I'm not saying it's not great for around the eyes, just don't get it in them. It burns the inside of the eye because if your not super careful when you put it around the eye, it's a serum and can run into the eye.

Since I'm buying this item through Amazon I was confident even though it was sold by a third party seller. However, when I received the product, package appeared to have been corrected. The original packaging was cut & peeled out in few places in the front and completely in the back (Looks like it was cut out intentionally so it can not be sold as new). Reprinted sticker was attached on top of the original packaging. Of course you are not going to find fixed up package sold as new at the legitimate store but this one was sold at a discounted price. My wife who use this product thinks inside seems like a genuine article. My guess is seller bought this as defective/reject item at a low wholesale price, fix or in this case tape over the damage area, and sold it. I guess I could've returned it but you get what you pay for right? And in this case you are using what's inside the box. If it wasn't for the patched up packaging I would give the seller and the product 5 stars.

For the price of this product I expected more of a payoff. It's only good for the inside of your eye by the tear duct. Plus the applicatior bleeds out to much product thats wasted. Don't waste your money on this

I thought I finally found a product to help with my aging skin (I'm in my forties). It cleans really well and love the way the unit is made, very well and hopefully will last a long time, but after using for 4 weeks I haven't noticed any change with my pores unfortunately.
This product arrived totally rock solid frozen! I am using it as I was completely out of it. It is very watery. I won't be purchasing it again.

Based on very positive reviews I finally decided to try Philosophy Microdelivery Exfoliating Wash. After using it just once I was unimpressed but I continued to use it daily and I'm disappointed to say it works no better than much cheaper drugstore brands like Neutrogena or Olay. I'll finish the bottle but won't be ordering it again. I'm subtracting one star simply because of the price.

I can't really live without this little gem. Been using one for about 11 years. It generally lasts about 2-3 years, and when batteries no longer work, it's time to buy another.There is nothing like it anywhere. (I just wish I had the foresight to order one before the batteries died today.)
first when i felt the brush it was really soft but then at the night i tried it on my face. it was so harsh on my skin. my opinion i hate it.

I have used this perfume for years and I do know how it smells. I'v got this one today from Amazon. This is not original Kenzo Ca Sent Beau. It smells horrible. Unless it was stored somewhere for long time and the perfume is spoiled. Perhaps, the packaging does not look like original either. I am very disappointed. It is trash.

Used this on my daughter's hair, and it turned out really, really bright. It looks like we colored her hair with a highlighter! Which was fine for us, but if you really want a banana yellow, I would pass on this one.

I had such high hopes for this product. In fact, before I purchased it I told everyone I'd found this amazing peel on Amazon but I take that back.I won't advise anyone to stay away from the product as it obviously worked for many people. I'm african american with a medium complexion. I have combination skin with blocked pores and dark marks all over my face from acne. I used this product for 4 weeks, once every 5 days and the only outcome was incredibly dry/old looking skin even if I used a good moisturizer. All of the marks on my skin are now darker than they were prior to using the product and it did nothing to combat acne. I didn't leave the product on for more than 4 minutes yet the last and final time I did, the skin on my chin burned off leaving bruises.For me, it wasn't worth it.

I've been using the shampoo for nearly three weeks and have not had any type of reaction to my very reactive skin. since it is practically everything-free you have to use two or three applications to really get your hair clean.
its kinda slimy feeling i think you could do more with a scrub than this. i dont use it anymore instead i use the indian clay mask and a deep conditioning cleanser and my face has been amazing!!

Like everyone else said, this is a MUST HAVE for nursing mommies. My husband fully contends that without this cream I wouldn't have made it past day 3. I was cracked and bleeding when I got home from the hospital, so my husband picked this up at Target for me. I was healed in a matter of days and am still happily nursing at 4 1/2 months.

Excellent fragrance! My husband is somewhat of a cologne connoisseur, and London passed the test with flying colors. It has a the perfect mix of that manly, earthly smell with a touch of sweetness. I belive my husband has found a new permanent scent.

The delivery was prompt and the condition of the item was great, but I was disappointed by the actual color of the polish. On this site, it looks to be a very light purple/lavender/lilac shade, but really, it's more of a light pink that you could get at any store.
The color of the powder is not the same that was shown in the profile, the color is not beige, is more white than beige.The item came well packed.

I had acrylic nails for 11 years before my real nails became too weak to withhold the acrylic. When I took off the acrylic for good, to allow my real nails to breath and hopefully strengthen, they were very fragile and would literally fall away like sand when filed. They would not grow back and were always breaking. Once I started using Duri Rejuvacote they immediately began to "shape up". They're now strong and healthy- I can now grow them to the length of what I previously had my acrylics at! My nail polish stays on longer too; LOVE Rejuvacote!

I read all the reviews on these types of products. I have tried others, but they didn't seem to make my nails stronger so tried this. I feel as though it is helping slightly to strengthen my nails, but was quite disappointed that it peals off, even if it is used as a Top Coat, which it recommends to do.I had acrylic nails for many years. Evidently, it will take me many years to get them back where they need to be.If anyone knows of a product that works better then this, PLEASE let me know.

Smells good, feels good, but having gotten it for so cheap, I'm still not sure if it's the real thing or an imposter. I've never used Alterna before and need to find a legit. beauty supply store that will let me feel a little bit of the real thing to compare.Perfume's not fantastic, but it's o.k. Seems to work o.k., so far.Aug. 21-09 O.K., I've been using it for several weeks now and really like it. The perfume grows on you. My hair seems to be getting healthier. Found a beauty supply store that let me feel a little bit of what this is supposed to be, and I'll guess this is the real stuff.
This blush is very light, but natural. I use it alone, or combine it on top of bronzers or darker blushes. It seems to blend well with most colors. Definitely a good "basic " to always have on hand.

I purchased this item as a replacement gift for a similar product that was nearing the end of its useful life (20 plus years). The old unit had fluorescent tubes as a light source. The new unit had four very small incandescent bulbs.Use of the new unit was straight forward. However selecting any light mode other than "daylight" turned on only two of the four bulbs which in addition to producing a very dim light, produced shadows on the face as makeup was being applied. Also, this unit did not have an electrical outlet on the front panel that was very convenient on the old product. There are better products out there, especially those with fluorescent tubes as the light source.

I've had a similar one to this many years ago. My disappointment was the foam on the curlers were awful-actually crumbling off the plastic before I'd even used it. When I called the company I was told they would replace them, but first I had to mail the original ones back to them. That means waiting for replacements, and no hair curlers in the meantime. Plus the cost to me of returning them. Not what I had expected.

I had barely dyed my hair for the first time this month with the L'Oreal Feria color dye from the store. It only gave a hint of red and lasted a week before it was completely gone. I then decided to go with the L'Oreal Hi Excellence. My original hair color is a dark brown, thick, and passed my middle back, and there was no isssue in the red actually showing up. It has now been two weeks and it's still noticeable. I keep getting compliments on this new hair color and I can't help but to enjoy the compliments. Someone the other day actually asked if I got it professionally done. I would definitely recommend this product.
this color is hot and will be a great color for my 3d hello kitty nail art SUPER FAST AND GREAT SHOP
The product works as designed. I had no problems with it whatsoever. The appearance of the box, iron & components, upon delivery, was impeccable.

PROS: Long-lasting. Waterproof. Lightweight. Hypo-allergenic. Non-comedogenic. Fragrance free.CONS: Packaging is portable, however it becomes hard to get out when about 1/2 full. Only 3 shades (light, medium & dark), but they are neutral, sheer and very blendable. Only SPF 6.First of all, the important thing to remember is that this is a *tinted moisturizer*. While it's still makeup, it's not meant to give full (or even medium) foundation-like coverage... you shoudn't expect this to completely disguise blemishes or freckles. It probably won't, but it will even skin tone. That said, the color selection is very limited, but, for most, I don't think that would be too much of a problem. The light shade looks dark and beige in the tube, but blends wonderfully and looks natural on my light, warm-toned skin. You should be safe as long as you don't go to the opposite end of the spectrum when choosing your shade. An SPF of at least 15 would be nice, but I suppose some is better than none, and I'm used to applying sunscreen anyway. It's very lightweight and feels natural, non-greasy and moisturizes sufficiently. It leaves a finish somewhere halfway between dewy and matte, making it look just like bare, healthy skin. It's waterproof, lasts for a very long time (though I can't attest to how it stands up during heavy activity) and washes off easily with a cleanser or makeup remover.

The blower dryer works but I am convenienced it is not new as they advertisied it was. It sounds like a used blow dryer and makes a noise that looks like it will break any second also the packaging that it came in was horrible.MV Miami, FL

I have purchased a couple of these for myself as well as 1 for a gift and plan on additional purchases as gifts going into the holidays. Suggest purchasing the "testers" for personal use to save a little money if you don't care about the top (or save the top from one of your bottles to reuse) or gift canister. Not the best as far as "longevity" with regard to the sent lasting but for the cost a good product.

The book is a good concept and there are good ideas and thoughts intermingled, but I didn't agree with a lot of things they said. The biggest part I disagreed with is dealing with kids' boundaries. But I think everyone has to decide that for themselves. I felt what they said about kids would lead them to become brats. On the other hand, I learned some things about my own boundaries that helped me to deal with my own parents.
Does its job. Easy to handle. Seems to be the right size. We will have to wait and see on how long it holds it's sharpness.

Smells OK, nothing to die for. I have tried better. Dont think it works, only the delivery man is only one knocking on my door, even before I bought this. Lol. Everybody has different chemestry, maybe it doesn't work with mine. This is something you have to try on your own to see if it works for you and you like it. For me, didn't work, dont care much how it smells.

i dont understand people who say this stuff is great, it doesnt even take off regular mascara let alone waterproof. plus if i get it in my eye accidentally, it burns! so much for gentle. it does, however, take off foundation well without stripping my skin or breaking me out. rinse with water after, even though it says you dont have to, because it tastes HORRID if you lick your lips.

but this just does not have the complete original smell it had back in the day. My grandma used to have this and I always put it one when I was younger. This may or may not be original or it might just be old.

I feel like a giant lemon bar when I use this product. This is a gently clarifying shampoo I use once a week or so, alternating with the Alba Botanicals product line. The smell and lather is great (lathers a LOT more than the usual "natural" hair products). Organic, too!
The blades are not very sharp so don't use it on your face, it will pull out your hair

I bought this product because I could not find the Burt's Bees Belly Butter anywhere. This product is so greasy...didn't even want to get dresses after putting it on! The Burt's Bees product is soooo much better, but can't be found anywhere!

I used Roasted Chestnut color for years. It lasted forever and never dried out my hair. I didn't think there would be a difference in the color or how long it last with the new "improved" version. I was very sadly mistaken. First, the new version did not cover up all my gray, and I don't have that much, yet. The old version did. Second, the new version doesn't even last a week. And even when I use the 2 week touch up, it only lasted a few days. I am so disappointed that Clairol changed the chemistry of their Natural Instincts line. It used to be a great product. I can't find a similar hair color like this one. And I have gone to the salon to get my hair colored and I still like the old Roasted Chestnut color the best. I'm sad that I won't be able to use it anymore, VERY SAD. I just loved that color.

I've been using this product for years, and I used to LOVE it, but now, I'd have to say I only "like" it. The latest bottle I bought seems to feel like a slightly different product. It still seems great as a sunblock, and, so far, I haven't noticed more frequent breakouts, but the lotion feels much more slimy to me than it used to. I often wear it without makeup, and in the past, it gave my skin a nice matte look that I liked very much. The latest bottle makes my skin look way too shiny! And I notice that when I wear it under my mineral makeup, the makeup seems to cake in spots of my face unless I make a special effort to blot up any extra lotion.I imagine I'll continue to use this product, but I don't plan to recommend it to my friends the way I used to. I am also using much less which means it'll probably be a long time before I'll use up this bottle. In the past, with daily use, I used about one bottle every 9 months to a year, but I'm now applying about half as much lotion as I did in the past.

Bought these as a present for my Girlfriend this Christmas. She LOVES them! Simply pop them in the microwave when her feet get cold, and a minute later - warm comfy bliss for her! Heating beads remind her of sand, she squishes them around with her toes while she wears them.Can't walk in them, and they won't fit over two pairs of socks, but there are no complaints otherwise. Well made. If you are looking for something to heat your feet when the snow flies, you can't go wrong with these! Can also be put in the freezer to cool feet during the summer . . .

It leaves at least 15-20% of lotion at the bottom. Which given the price of the lotion, I hate to waste. Yes, I can turn the bottle around and get some of it out. But I don't like to do it because it's very inconvenient.How hard is it to design a bottle that doesn't make you choose between inconvenience and waste?

I got allergic reaction when I used Shea Moisture Organic & Aloe Thikening Growth Milk because it has Grape seed oil.Grape seed oil has so many side effects, I'd like grape seed oil to be eliminated from the formula.
Great tool if you know how to use it. I've had my hair dresser working with me to show me how to use it. It's taking time to learn to use it and get the kind of results I am looking for.

Got one of these for Christmas, liked it so much I had to get another. And will probably ask for some more this Christmas too. Great material, light to wear, and not sure how it soaks up so much sweat. Not like Terry Cloth bands that I have to trade out after a couple of racquetball matches, these things will hold up for 2-3 hours of play. Awesome.

I thought this would be very opaque in 2 coats, but it's so sheer I need 3 generous coats to seal completely.And the little glitter doesn't stand out without topcoat.I'm glad I didn't order the complete collection.Not so into this color for it's sheerness.

After using the Sex Bomb Bath Bomb for the first time, I must admit I was greatly disappointed! The pink water was kind of attractive, and it was quite fun watching the ball explode into a fizzing fountain, but the smell was similar to musty, heavy talc powder." As I bathed, I tried to convince myself that the smell wasn't that bad until my seven year old son opened the door and stopped in mid sentence to ask, "what's that aweful smell?" I couldn't deny the obvious and pulled the drain plug. As I watched my efforts go down the drain, I noticed my squeezed out washcloth draped over the side of the tub with a memorable tinge of bright pink to remind myself not to buy the Sex Bomb again. The bathroom smelled for close to a week, it was terribly strong! I definitely would not buy another one of this scent but did since order the Butterball Bath Bomb and it's fabulously rich in moisture, like taking a bath in lotion and very faint butter cream smell!

I thought this would be very opaque in 2 coats, but it's so sheer I need 3 generous coats to seal completely.And the little glitter doesn't stand out without topcoat.I'm glad I didn't order the complete collection.Not so into this color for it's sheerness.
Nice blow dryer while it lasted. I've had it less than 2 years and the fan bearing are going out. Sounds horrible. I'm disappointed that it didn't last longer.
Not my favorite...I like Avon glimmer stick. Liner disappears during the day. The tiny bit of shadow (hidden in the middle) does not even show on my eyes.
Love this fragrance. It is easy to wear and not as heavy as the other Burberry scents. It seems lighter and younger.
After opening the package ,the spray broke .And I can't used it.I am very disappointed at this product. Is there anyway that I change the perfume.

If you want a natural nail tint, that looks like color of the real nail bed, this is the shade for you. It is not as pink as the photo; it's more cream. Really sheer, just perfect for a french manicure. Not for me though, I like my colors more saturated, even with a Fnch.ManiFollow up April 30, 2011: I went to the local salon, and found this shade, and guess what? this shade is not sheer. It is semi opaque. A few coats will give solid coverage. And the color is a creamy soft pink; not like the one I purchased on Amazon. Don't know what is up with the distributor; not the seller. Very disapointed, 'cause I have had to return 3 nail lacquers thus far; and without return shipping reimbursement.Update: The seller did reimburse one way shipping charges.

First, I was very much unimpressed by this hair dryer. Given its price, I was expecting something significantly better than a 20 dollar dryer -- NONE. And it's no featherweight, it's heavier than my previous one.Second, I found that I couldn't register this product because its lack of the serial number. Though on the manual, it specifically says if the serial number is missing, it might not be authentic. So here goes the warranty comes with the bespoke itself. But I reasoned it must still be authentic since it's sold by amazon..Third, I went to sephora and found this one on shelf. Man, the one in sephora, though looked exactly like this one I had, but it's real featherweighted -- just by this, I didn't even need to try out the functionality of that one in sephora to understand I have got this fake one from Amazon.Amazon tried to charge me restocking fee for this one that is fake. I need a resolution!!Please don't buy, it's fake.

I had used this a few years ago and was simply amazed by it. Unfortunately it's not the same anymore. It's way too orange...and this is supposed to be the nude. Also way messier than it used to be. I nearly destroyed a hotel bathroom with this. The biggest reason I got this was b/c of how amazing it camouflaged cellulite and spider veins...it's just didn't do that anymore unless you seriously coat it....disappointing...it's just not the same.
Its a really pretty color and its creamy so it doesn't dry out the lips, however i settles in lip lines, so I recommend exfoliating lips before you apply. Especially since the color isn't that subtle
I love this spray! Whenever I wear it I get complements and the smell lasts for a long time. I was so glad I could find a large bottle. My husband and I think it smells like fruit or mangoes.
Very nice, tropical scent!It's one you'd like to continuously smell! Not strong but just right.It's a refreshing spritz, for sure.

Bought this to use on my should length hair. The pick doesn't stay in the handle, but I didn't really care about that. I think the barrel is a little small for the length of my hair, I should have gone with the 2 1/8" barrel. It does make my hair shiny and bouncy. My only real complaint is the handle. It's a very grippy material which is great for my fingers to hold onto, but my hair grips onto it too! I often have to untangle my hair from around the handle. I think I would prefer a more slippery handle so that my hair would just slide off. So I'm still looking for the perfect round brush.
I love this product! It does not go on orange - it's gives a great bronze color!

Mirror is thin enough to fit on inside of medicine chest door. Only 3x magnification, but that is actually preferred after using. Adhesive tape already on back of mirror (2" circular pad) worked with no issues at all. Very satisfied with this product!
Produce just like described. The service was wonderful but I had to return the item. The wife already bought one. the return went smooth. I will do business with them again.

I smelled a tester of this on my last cruise and fell in love with it. I ordered it from Amazon and when I got the bottle open and sprayed it on, it smelled the same, but seemed to be a watered-down version of the one I tested. I paid $56+ for this perfume and may send it back. Too bad, it smelled great on the boat!!!

I loved this hairbrush until it started breaking a ton of hair. I love the handle and brush size but when I used it to dry my hair straight, my hair would get wrapped around the rubber grip parts on the handle and break. My hair is pretty strong but when I pull it around the brush while drying, it tended to get wrapped in the grooves where the rubber is on the handle. This would have been a great hairbrush if only the handle would be plain wood and didn't have the crevices in the brush where hair can get caught. I now have a ton of small little hairs on my head that stand up. I have changed hairbrushes and am waiting for those hairs to grow out. If you are not using this brush for straightening your hair, then you might have better luck with it. It's a great brush but just didn't work for me.
i've used it before and loved it. now, all of a sudden i'm allergic to it. my face was so itchy.

The polish looks much lighter in the bottle in real life than in the picture, but it's much brighter on your fingers than in the bottle. It's also pearlescent, which was kind of a surprise to me. I love the color though, along with China Glaze in general. It dries SUPER FAST.The product is very hard to work with, however. Since it's a white based color, it's hard to get it to apply evenly. It's also very matte, so if you want it to be shiny, use a top coat.
I bought this item based on reviews. Definitely not to my liking. Not sure how to describe same. Going to give it to relative. Hoping her taste is different from mine.
This is a awesome perfume and the price is amazing too! I've never been able to buy it at this price before! It's a nice floral scent that can be worn year round. I would highly recommend!
I have tried other conditioners and always come back to this one. This is my favorite. My hair is full, shiny and healthy. I also use the shampoo! Fav pair!

I am a little older and have basically "normal" skin with some aging concerns starting to develop - yet I STILL have occasional breakouts, and clogged pores in my T-zone. So I was looking for something that would clear my skin without over-drying. This cleanser did the job. Of course, I still use a moisturizer with sunscreen.
Like the other Avon makeup I bought, this turns your face orange. It doesn't even cover up any blemishes. What is the point of putting on makeup if all your flaws show through the orange glow?????

On the 5TH DAY of use EVER, this drier burned off a WHOLE SECTION of my hair! I smelled burning and turned off the drier, ran my hand over my hair and the whole section fell to the floor! The hairs were scorched and melted together. My hairdresser always comments on the great health of my long hair, I've never processed it, I never even get split ends, so that's not even an issue here. I bought this drier because my last Revlon drier was great. Never again! I've complained to Revlon, still waiting to hear from them.

Essie has some very beautiful colors, but all the nailpolishes have formaldehyde. There are other brands that also have pretty colors and are Big 3 free. Would not recommend this product. 3 stars for the color selection.

I have been using this product for about three weeks, and I've noticed a decrease in breaking. I have very soft nails, that usually spit or tear before growing past the fingertip. Since I've been using this product, that has not happened. I still have some peeling, but I'm hoping that will go away with continued use.Warning: This is a strenghther and is NOT designed for those who like to wear pretty polish every day. I recommend using the clear, "buffed sheen" color. That way, you don't have to deal with the peeling that occurs with the colored, ("pearl sheen")product.

I will not order from this vendor again. I placed a order for Perry Ellis 360 White for Women. I receive the mens cologne which I gave to my husband because I was so irritated and didnt want to go through the aggrevation of sending it back.

This is Babor's version of La Mer, with a price tag to match ($400). It claims to be magically brewed like La Mer, with their Sea-Telligent complex,(cut and pasted claims): "A high-energy ingredient obtained from a deep-sea microorganism. Thanks to its anti-oxidative properties, it protects the skin thoroughly against the effects of stress. Because the extract is both thermoactive and UV-activated, it generates heat, which further enhances its effect on the skin."Well, i received a small jar of this and i swear it transformed my dry, blemished skin overnight into a dewy, glowing complexion. I was so thrilled with the results that i shelled out for the full-size product (my bank account cried), and.... sadly the results i initially saw never came back. In fact, this cream doesn't have **any** quantitative/clinically based claims to back it up--just a fairytale marketing story, some obscure technology, and a hefty sticker price. It's just a rich moisturizer, in my opinion.I found the cream increasingly too heavy for my skin, making it an oily mess before bed---apply sparingly. the richness of this cream also made my pores "heavy", prone to milia, and more visible as a result. I would only recommend this cream for mature skins. The wide-mouthed jar is unsanitary and prone to bacteria when you re-dip your fingers. For such a "high-tech superluxe" product, it should come in an airless pump system.

I used this twice a week for 6 weeks and didn't notice a difference in my acne at all. My skin got incredibly dry, which is to be expected, but no difference other than that. I'm disappointed as I read such other great reviews.
I wasnt sure what color of the numbers i am... so i went with this one bcus its light but it came and it was actually really dark..

I really like the smell of sandalwood so I bought this perfume oil. The smells takes a while to settle, meaning, the smell softens the longer you have it on. I discovered this after putting some on my wrist, and didn't like the initial pungent odor. I kept smelling it for about a half an hour, and was pleasantly surprised how the smell had changed.

Long Time Browning Lotion user, My bad for reading ALL the reviews. The 5 bottle I ordered in the 4oz size was a repackaged product. Not the same High Quality of Maui Babe's product. Does NOT come in a SEALED bottle so repackaging is happening here. Probably old and mixed up again.. I would not recommend any product that is re-packaged like this..BeWare...

I just had my toe digits done and was a little disappointed. The Pink look in the bottle is not what landed on my toes. More of a beigy look. Can anyone suggest a another color for me. I tried Vanity too and the same thing.

This hairdryer is quieter than most and works great. I owned three, but that was the problem. I purchased it three times because I loved it so much. However, each hairdryer lasted less than a year, and I used it probably four times per week. I was very disappointed in what seemed to be a great hairdryer of poor quality in that was unable to last. Sad to have to switch to something more reliable!
The bottle shows a turquoise color, but when you spray your hair it is actually VERY dark blue. Cool color, but not the one on the cap!

I'm 55, Irish, freckled, wrinkled and have a few dark age/sun damage spots on my face. Everything makes me break out, but not this stuff. Every other night, I use Neutrogena Acne Stress Control 3-in-1 Hydrating Acne Treatment before applying the AlphaHydrox Souffle. Maybe that helps too. The wrinkles around my mouth are visibly reduced as is one particularly annoying age spot on my cheek. I love this stuff. I've only used it for a month. I'm nearly out, so I'm ordering more because I don't want to be without it.

I bought 2 of these (one is rip stop & it is stronger) for our intensive care nursery. We use them for emergency supplies, drugs etc. to take to high risk infant deliveries. This is the third set of baggallini's I have purchased. Unfortunately these don't have the double zipper for locking medications, so we will have to adapt them somehow. Also, the material doesn't seem as strong, so when these wear out, I will probably be looking for another bag. But everyone loves the vibrant colors.

I purchased this because I was looking for a large barrette that would hold thick hair. I had purchased less expensive barrettes in beauty supply stores, but the clasp was usually glued to an "anchor" which was then glued to the decorative piece. Because my hair is so thick, I would usually break the barrettes in the struggle of getting all of my hair in it. The clasp of this barrette appeared to be connected to the decorative piece (rather than an "anchor"), so, I thought it would work better. At $30, I expected the clasp to be of higher quality than the less expensive barrettes. It was not. The clasp on this $30 barrette was exactly the same, poor quality as those on my $5 barrettes. I was deeply disappointed.
The cap was broken on this it, but I transferred it to another. Not much care is given to packaging.
I used this product for over a 6 months. The puffiness and darkness under my eyes were not reduced. The product did not work for me.

I've been using these for about 3 weeks now...not really sure what to think yet. I can see the logic behind them - keep the muscles from activating & there's less reason to crease. However, they recommend you use them overnight - & I wonder how much I'd be wrinkling my forehead while sleeping without them. Also, I don't see how I'd ever get to the point where I wouldn't need to use them every night & it'd just be maintenance. In the morning when I remove them, I do see a difference. But the difference seems incredibly short-term.I will continue to use them for now, but jury is out as to whether I think they work as advertised. Leaning towards no.UPDATE: Stopped using them. They did nothing in the long run.

I bought the T3 featherweight for my wife as a Christmas gift for my wife. She has extremely thick hair and drying it takes a very long time. After purchasing the T3 from an authorized dealer, I found the Good Housekeeping review that gave a favorable review of the Revlon Tourmaline Ionic. Since the Revlon is 1/10th the cost, I bought one at Target and gave both to my wife for Christmas.I was hoping that she would find the Revlon comparable and we could save the expense of the T3. No such luck. She first used to T3 and found that it was much quieter than her current dryer and that it reduced the time it took to dry her hair by about 10 minutes. When she next used the Revlon, she ended up burning her hair and refuses to ever use it again. She's been using the T3 for about three weeks as remains very happy with it.Being the more analytical one, I decided to do a scientific comparison between the two. Note that I only had one sample of each dryer and I didn't use calibrated instruments, so these observations are only useful in comparing the two samples that I had.The first and most important difference concerned the temperature of the air exiting these two dryers while set for high output and hot temperature. The T3 held a fairly consistent temperature that most of the time fell between 190 and 210 degrees. Extremes fell between 180 and 230 degrees, but these were for only a second or two before the temperature returned to 200+/-10 degrees.The Revlon was much less consistent. Its temperature continuously fluctuated between 130 and 235 degrees. Once I observed the temperature spike to almost 260 degrees. I must have been one of these spikes the burned my wife's hair. I took measurements over three different periods and noticed wide fluctuation during each one. Keep in mind that I only had one sample of each dryer so these problems may be caused by a defective unit and not indicative of the entire line.Both dryers are very quiet compared to those that my wife has used in the past. The T3 ran at about 100 decibels at the intake and output ends and about 90 decibels on the side. From one foot away, the dryer ran from 78 to 84 decibels. The Revlon was a little louder, running about 105db at the ends to 90db on the side. From one foot, it in ranged from 82-89 decibels. These measurements were taken in our bathroom which has almost no sound absorption.The Revlon did push out more air. On the high settings, the air exiting the Revlon had almost twice the force of that of the T3. On the low setting, T3 had about 75% of the force of the Revlon.Bottom line: The Revlon had temperature problems and burned my wife's hair. If that could be fixed, it would be a great dryer as it's 1/10 the cost on the T3. But, right now, there's no way my wife is going to give up her T3.
This mask is amazing! When I use it, I feel exactly as refreshed as if I had a salon facial! :) I recommend it very happily.
I do absolutely LOVE this color...but I found out the hard way that China Glaze chip SUPER fast. I guess I will stick to OPI!

I have purchased Dermalogica from a skin care boutique, and this is NOT QUITE the same. It isn't as rich nor does it cover as well. It also has a bit of a grainy texture. Still, the SPF DOES seem to work, and it moisturises satisfactorally. It's just not the same stuff you get in the store.

I ordered this for my daughter for her birthday. When she opened it the top of the bottle was broken. The edges were very sharp, and she could have been cut. It is her favorite perfume, but will send it back for a replacement.

Got this for a girlfriend. The scent is amazing to me and she loves it as well. I know perfumes are an individual preference thing, but this smells great and isn't overbearing. Amazon has a great price on it as well.

This is the third type of gel wax I've tried and my least favorite. It's very stiff and sticky. If you are looking for more of a firm hold from a gel wax this might be for you. Not what I was looking for.

Celluthin (8oz) #1 Topical Cellulite Reducing Cream with 2% AminophyllineAfter reading all the raves I was so excited to try this product. Sadly, after 30 days of using it religously and even stepping up my diet and walking program. I walk 3 miles at least 5 times a week. I stepped that up to 5 miles 3 times a week 3 miles the other 2 days. I also, started using the eliptical rider. And I dieted. I used this product in the mornings and evenings. No change what so ever in appearance and in inches. And I ordered 2 bottles, overly optimisticly.Now, I REALLY wonder about all these positive postings.... I will continue on with the second bottle since I bought it... But I doubt another months will make a difference. It probably was a waste of $100 bucks.I hope others have better luck with this product than I've had. I am 49, 5'2" and weigh 120. But I do have heavy thighs for my frame - my problem area and have had horrible celulite since I hit puberty. Arggh!! I guess I will do what I have always done. Just live with it.

I love the clean, crisp smell of Pure Grace by philosophy so much so that I haven't even tried the other scents. It's a little more expensive than I would normally spend, but I find it very much worth the price.Philosophy Pure Grace Soap And Water

I had high hopes for this shampoo/conditioner system. In truth, it's not bad. I have to say though, at least for me, it's not great either, and certainly not worth the extra money to buy the Wen product. My hair is mid-back length, and I get frequent compliments on it when I take the time to smooth it out with my flatiron and wear it down. When I don't smooth it out, though, it does tend to look dry and can get frizzy fast. My father used to call it "poufy," if that helps you to get a good mental picture. I bought Wen on a couple of people's recommendations, and I got the kind for extra dry hair -the fig version. I'd have to agree with some of the reviews that comment on the smell of this version. It is pretty much like cherry medicine. While it isn't terrible, it isn't something that will lure the men in, I don't think, and it lingers in your hair until the next time you wash it. The shampoo/conditioner itself isn't bad. It might have made my hair feel marginally softer after I washed it the first time. It didn't actually help it to smooth out any, though, and I was hoping that would happen. After carefully reviewing the product before I bought it, I was hoping I would have some sort of miraculous experience with it like so many others had. I didn't. I didn't have a terrible experience either, but I would have to say that, if you are going to spend the big bucks on this shampoo, buy it from Wen directly so that, if you are like me and `ehh' about it, you can at least send it back for a refund.

I bought this product direct through the Completely Bare website, and it's an okay product. All it is, is a $32 jar of acne pads. So I would recommend just going to walmart or some drug store and buying some acne pads for sensitive skin. The only reason to buy this product is if you REALLY love the packaging, because that's all that your paying for. It even says on the packaging that the product is for the treatment of acne. Buy it somewhere else for a heck of a lot less money.

I bought a bottle of Home Health Castor oil from my local health foods store about a month ago and it doesn't expire for another TWO YEARS and I was very disappointed to find a large mold cloud forming in the bottom of the bottle (which is a clear bottle so it's very easy to see). I thought because it was cold pressed and the only ingredient is "Ricinus Communis (Castor) Seed Oil" that it could be stored at room temperature (I haven't read anywhere that it needed to be store in the fridge, no where on the product label either). I've always kept Olive oil and jojoba oil out of the fridge and they do fine. I guess I would recommend to others to try keeping it in the fridge. I and VERY DISAPPOINTED, MONEY WASTED.

I ordered this on May 3rd assuming is would be recieved by mothers day on May 10th. It didn't even ship until May 12th. I'm not sure why it took so long to ship, but it missed mothers day by almost a whole week by the time it arrived on May 15th. Boo Hoo.

I ordered this polish for what the salon used to call an American Manicure, which is more pink than the traditional French Manicure. After the first coat of polish, it was streaked badly. The polish was so thick, I couldn't get a second coat on the nail. I kept adding polish thinner, quite a lot ultimately, to get it to a thinner texture. It still streaked after the first coat, as well as after a second coat. I put the polish away for a few days but decided to give it one more try before giving up. This time the polish didn't streak after one thin, carefully applied coat, which was exactly the color I wanted. With one coat and a good top coat, it is a very natural looking manicure.After a lot of frustration adding thinner again and again to get the right texture and some time letting the polish meld with the thinner, I have the color and texture of polish I wanted. I will use this bottle of polish as long as it does not start streaking again, but I'm unsure if I will purchase another bottle.

The shower cap is large enough, and the satin lining is also nice. But the elastic on the cap began to fray immediately upon use. I like the shower cap, but I don't expect that it will last very long.

I have tons of very fine wavy hair and smaller hot rollers make me look like an elderly poodle. I want them to smooth out the kinks, add some lift, and finish the ends, and these rollers do the trick.I've used this type of pin for years and so I didn't find them difficult to use - but they take a little practice.No pin marks, no fishhook ends, no frizz, no problem!Now I wish they made a set with even bigger rollers! How about 2", Conair?

This past summer I spent some time in Nice and bought some rose-scented French soap. I loved the smell and went to the internet to find a perfume that was like that. I read many reviews before I purchased So Magic, and it sounded as if it was just what I wanted....but it wasn't. This perfume is discontinued, and it may be that the perfume is a little old and not quite what it used to be. This is a very sweet scent ( almost cloying) that might be nice on a young girl between 10 and 16, but not for any woman who is looking for a real fragrance. It's my own fault for buying perfume online without smelling it first. I will not do that again.

When I did a search for this, I was shocked to see this price. I was going through my email and linked to Vermont Country Store. They have found a vendor that produce the same oil from the original Nivea and sell it under another name; it's close to $30. Just try a search of skin oil and it will probably come up there.I remember using this years ago, and thought it amazing that it healed scratches overnight from my cat. I had always wondered why they quit making it.

I am not that impressed with it, but I bought it for my wife and she really likes it which is what counts more than my opinion. It doesn't seem to be very strong to me. It seems to be very faint perfume but it also does seem to last a long time.

This product is like mascara but presumably with a little more staying power. It is not much larger than mascara either (which I have also tried). I have used it in front at crown of head and it does cover the growing in light roots and at sides also. It goes on easily and lasts a few days. I don't use it often and only to protect my hair from the drying results of doing a complete hair dye of entire head.

I bought this as an afterthought to round out my order, but now that I've had it a while I must say I have found it to be really useful. Instead of fighting with snags and snarls I simply run this wide tooth comb through my hair a few times and after that a regular comb just glides right on through with no problems. I never knew that this type of comb was so handy. Highly recommended if you haven't tried one before.

I was so excited to get my FHI. When it FINALLY arrived this morning, I opened it up, took a shower, and proceeded to put it to use. Just so you know, my hair isn't thick or thin, but somewhere in the middle. You know, average. But it is naturally curly... VERY naturally curly. So anyway, I read the instructions and set it to about 230, thinking I could always lower the temperature if that was too hot.After my hair was blow-dried, I put half of it up and started to gently press the plates on the bottom layer of my hair, and slid them down gently, without tugging or pulling (like the instructions said). And viola! The curl just popped right back at me, same as before.So now what? Well, I did what anyone would've done and moved the temperature up a bit and tried again. This time the curl slightly bounced back, but not like before. So after about ten strokes, the curl was gone and this piece of hair was perfectly straight... but I still had about a whole head of hair to go.Eventually it was all straight as a stick, and I decided I wanted a bit of a flip in the front. My hair is cut in the scene/punk style, so flipping is a must. I took some gel made for this, and put a little on the tips of my hair, then used the straightener to flip the ends... and nothing. As I write this review my hair is straight and a bit lifeless, but straight none the less. I bought this product thinking it could make my hair more flippy and straight, but no. I'm glad I bought it, but it's defiantly not what it claims to be.
Since the packaging looked dubios, I am not sure if this is an original. I am hoping that it is.It sure smells like it. But i was a little disappointed that it was NOT a perfectly packaged box.

I was searching for a "pure" lotion without any harsh ingredients and was excited to find this. I was extremely disappointed for a couple of reasons:1. Smells horrible after several minutes, smells like throw up with a hint of fruit..2. Does not work for dry elbows/knees3. Did not make my skin feel smooth or hydrated/I honestly cannot believe I paid 17 dollars for this lotion. It did nothing for my skin and there is not that much product for the money.I want my money back :/

I have been looking for a more natural alternative to the regular store brands, so decided to try Naturtint, and I am so thrilled I did!The scent is not terrific, but it's not altogether unpleasant, and definitely not as harsh as the usual at home coloring kits (L'Oreal, etc). The product also spread really well and easily throughout my hair. I have slightly longer than shoulder length hair and there was plenty of product to cover my hair, as well as some left over.CONS: The gloves are not very high quality and are awkward fitting, but did the job fine.The after conditioner is really runny, and not thick and luxurious as I am accustomed.The final color really exceeded my expectations! It's a beautiful sunny blonde and I love it! Two thumbs up! I will definitely be using Naturtint again. As a matter of fact, I am placing my next order now.

This is not a "normal" shampoo, at least in my opinion. It has an oil-like consistency, in a clear, green-tea color. It's hard to hold it in the palms and work up the lather. And this shampoo just doesn't lather well. I really have to add water little by little (even though the hair is already wet) and really take the time to work up the lather. And in the process I've got my hair all tangled with the constant rubbing-motion. Not the best thing to do for long thick hair. However, after rinsing, the hair does become noticeably softer. I still need to apply de-tangling product before I can comb through the hair, but the hair seems moisturized, so I guess the product does its job. No fragrance- just a natural, tree-oil-like smell. I've used it about 5 times so far. Will finish the bottle but probably not buy it again or recommend it to anyone with long hair.

The tube is correctly labeled for LIGHT natural brown. However, the color comes out a very dark brown. If this is truly their idea of light brown, then I would have to order a blond color to get light brown. Ordered two tubes, so am hoping the other tube is an ACTUAL light brown color.

The effects of this product were less-dramatic than what I had hoped. My complexion improved, but did not noticeably lighten. I suspect the most active ingredient at work was the sunscreen. The cream is actually a soft wax that becomes very uncomfortable with long hair and bothersome when perspiring. I tried applying before bed to feel my skin stick to the fabric and leave smears on my pillow. Sweating after application is dangerous, as the oil can get into your eyes. And it can take a few hours to be fully absorbed, leaving the consumer to grapple with these nuisances for a good part of their day, if used as directed. The search continues...
It smells great when you spray it on the card in a department store, but when you put it on your skin, the light summery smell instantly goes stale and you're left smelling like cheap cologne.

This product is not for everybody. I am black with biracial parents. I have naturally curly, wavy, and straight patterns of hair on my head, but mostly curly. I shampooed and conditioned my hair. Afterwards, I sectioned my hair and used a substantial amount of the leave-in conditioner. I allowed my hair to air dry. This product made my hair look dry and kinky. It also made my hair feel dry, like it was coated with something or had a residue on it. Maybe, I used too much, I don't know? I wish I had not purchased the large bottle. This product has a great smell, but it is not for me! Nevertheless, I guess I will have to keep spending money, until I find what works for me! The next product on my list to try is, Designline's "Curl Lock".
Smells so good. My face drinks this up. I mist my face after I wash it and then apply moisturiser while it is still damp. My face is ultra soft and dewey since adding this to my regimen.

ok so fake mac. first of all mac doesnt come with mirrors on the top of the package. and second if u want tp buy maac get it off maccosmetics.com and the reviews that say it is amazing. they r lame bc they dnt kno this is fake seriously its obvious. i woodnt buy this because u dont kno what it is made out of. so get it of their actual online store or go to a store. or counter

this is my favorite scent and i was looking here in amazon the cheapest one and i found it. its 3.4ml and its like 40% sale! it stays long and i always get compliment from my workmates.. smells freaking good so sexy smelling!
