It doesn't necessarily smell bad, but it kinda smells like lemony dish soap or like dial hand soap--like some commercial bathroom product--But you gotta hand it to them, it smells pretty damn good for a product having Saw Palmetto berries in it--in case you were unaware, saw palmetto extract and berries smell like pure vomit and death...lol! It is not strong scented, you'll just have a light fragrance of some industrial lemon-like handsoap while washing your hair.For the price, it's definitely worth it to at least try.

Demeter Fragrance Library - Gingerbread Cologne Spray 1ozDemeter caught my eye for their astounding selection of unique fragrances. I knew I wanted to get one, but was tied between the Jelly Belly Blueberry Muffin, Caramel, and Gingerbread. Being September and already feeling slightly festive for the autumn and following hollidays, I decided to go with the Gingerbread. Reviews from various sites left me apprehensive about the way it would turn out, some saying the smell wore off within five minutes, others saying that the fragrance was much too spicy and smelled almost like very cumin-y curry. As it turned out, none of those were true. The fragrance was the perfect combination of a cinnamon-y spiciness layered on an appropriate amount of sugary sweetness and an hour later, I'm still getting whiffs of it. I'm so glad this was my first Demeter fragrance as it has boosted my confidence in the line and I cannot WAIT to add more scents to my collection! Thank you, Demeter!

Everything else sucks.Edit - Oct. 20, 2011After using the conditioner for about two weeks, I noticed another downfall. My hands are very sensitive, and the conditioner actually makes my hands itch. Perhaps I should've known since it's so fragrant that it might irritate my hands. Beware if you have sensitive skin!

One tools has two tools that store inside the tool. One is is a elongated pyramid shaped tool. It was poorly finished and i do not think I will be able to polish it and the point is outright dangerous to use. A simple sewing needle touched to some ethanol to prick a whitehead in the center would be safer and more easily managed. You do not prick blackheads which are black but the black color is not dirt as most peope think. The oil becomes black when it is exposed to the air and appears black. You remove these with a tool that has a tiny hole in it and if it will not easily come out do not keep applying pressure. Soften your skin first with a hot wet towel and or a hot shower. After removing any blackheads use something like alcohol to kill any bacteria that could enter the pore you just removed a blackhead from. Then wash your face with a soap like safeguard or Dove and blot dry, Never vigorously rub your facial skin. Some whiteheads are extremely difficult to remove. so do not force it. They seem to be like a white "cyst" under your top layer of skin. It goes without saying but here it is anyway. Never squeeze a pimple. All you do is spread the pus deeper into your skin and make a real infection and probably create a scarring effect. To do anything safely you need your own tools and a bottle of isopropal or ethanol (which is difficult to find), and a bag of cotton balls. a fresh bar of mild soap to wash up before and after. A few new clean white hand towels and a few new clean white wash cloths and perhaps a tube of "Neosporin" triple antibiotic ointment to prevent infection. Do not loan tools out to anyone. You can use a clam shell eyeglass case to store all your blackhead and whitehead removal tools.

With slight forehead acne due to combination oily skin I was hoping to find a quick fix.The reviews on this product and the 10% Benzoyl Peroxide ingredient made me confident that this would do the trick. It did not smell like Aliage I guess since it is so old. I was disappointed but guess I should have known it would not age well, Not like wine right????

Electronics hobbyists, beware...Read on for more.I know that this is an oldie and a well-loved cologne, but I absolutely could not stand it. Personally, it would be a 1.5 star rating out of 5. But since I will factor in others' opinions about it, I will give it a neutral 3.I'm a 21 year old college student. I'm quite mature (I've been told) for my age, and I think my colognes tend to reflect it. I have only started getting into colognes recently, so I do not have the best nose. I can't tell you what notes are in each colognes, or what the base is of each one. But I do know what smells good to me and what doesn't. I've currently got UR by Usher, Chrome, Burberry London, 1 million, Le Male, Armani Code, and Blvgari Black in my regular rotation/collection.I tried this cologne the other day, and my initial impression was that it was very strong. The alcohol content of this cologne must be much higher than comparable EDTs. The only one I have smelled with more alcohol has been Nautica Blue. The alcohol overpowers the top notes.The dry-down is where it gets interesting. I can swear that Hugo smells exactly like breathing in the saccharin-sweet fumes from using rosin-core 60/40 lead solder while chewing 2-hour-old spearmint gum. It's uncanny. And it's not just my skin type. I let several friends and family members borrow it, and I smelled exactly the same thing on them. Soldering fumes and gum. I did notice that, for my friends and family that have never soldered anything before, they found this scent to be quite pleasant. However, anyone I knew that had soldered anything before or has been around someone else soldering knew the smell without me having to tell them anything.I haven't ruled out the possibility that I got a bad bottle/batch. I will certainly give it another try if I see it in a dept store. So although this is a classic frag, beware. Try it out before you buy it. Especially if you've ever soldered anything before and you didn't enjoy the fumes. It's definitely a unique scent.
Great product. It makes the skin tingle like it should but it doesn't dry the skin out very much. Still, I wished it didn't have so much alcohol in it. It irritates my eyes when I come near it.

I love this hair dryer! I have very thick naturally curly hair, but not the good kind...the kind that looks like I've been playing with electricity. So I have been blowing my hair out straight since high school. This process used to take atleast 30 minutes or more. I am not the kind of person who spends $100 on a beauty product, but once I tried this hair dryer there was no going back. The high wattage is a must! It cuts my drying time into less than 10 minutes. The cool shot button works almost immediately and helps to set hair when using a round metal brush to curl ends. The ultra thin nozzle assures no flyaways, giving a smooth and polished look. When i first started using this hair dryer, my friends thought I had just come from the salon. I havent been to a salon for a blowout since buying this hair dryer. The only reason I rated this product 4 out of 5 stars is that these more expensive hair dryers have the same shelf life as the less expensive ones. They typically only last about a year. But for me, $100 a year it worth it to have beautiful hair year round, and its still cheaper than the beauty salon.

I like to buy natural/organic products for every day use and this mascara is one example. It's not a volumizing or thickening mascara so if you want the heavy look and lashed that look like they have a pound on them, this one isn't for you. It has no heavy scent. It's NOT waterproof. It washes of easily too. I use a bit of water on the finger to dab the lashes and use organic baby shampoo to remove my make up at the sink and in the shower and it works beautifully.I purchased other Ecco Bella products with this item, same positive result.

My husband and I often go for a double appointment to get our hair cut. It was late, right before Christmas and we managed to get an appointment. The hairdresser was in a rush and had fit us in that night out of the kindness of her heart. So, she cut my hair and then let me play around with all the hair products and curling irons while she was cutting my husband's hair. I fell in love with the 1 1/4-inch curling iron she had. I then went looking for one for home use.This has a 1-1/4 inch chrome barrel which is perfect if you want "body" and not reallythat much curl. If you have very long hair, it would give you beautiful ringlets.20 Heat SettingsLow 1-5: Delicate, thin, easy-to-curl hairMedium 6-10: Average to Wavy or Treated hairMedium High 11-15: Thick or Wavy HairHigh 16-20: Hard to curl, coarse hairThe "20 Heat Settings" is what sold this product to me. I love the fact that my hairwill not melt even on a high setting. Most curling irons heat up way too much forme to use and that is why I rarely used them.Other features:On/Off Touch padLED Ready Indicator LightAutomatic Curl Release/Professional Spring GripTangle-Free Swivel CordComfort Grip HandleWorried about leaving this product on as you rush to work? No fear. It has an Automatic Shut-Off feature. The safety stand also allows you to set down the curler when not in use. The cool tip saves you from burning yourself.Traveling? This has Worldwide Dual Voltage (125-volt or 250-volt)With a 60 second Heat up feature, you can't go wrong with this product. This styling iron is also available in 1/2-inch, 3/4-inch, 1-inch and 1 1/2-inch sizes.~The Rebecca Review

I have been using the Bare Minerals line for a few years now. First started buying the kits at Ulta, but then discovered that Amazon had better prices plus no tax and even free shipping. Another plus with buying here is that I can choose exactly which products to purchase. Buying the kits at Ulta, I'd get stuck with colors and extra products that would never get used.Mineral veil is an awesome, all-around finishing powder. Use it as the final step to your makeup routine, regardless of what kind of foundation you are wearing ... (or not). Make sure you use a good brush, swirl and tap off the excess powder, then just lightly buff over your entire face and neck. You'll instantly notice more even, flawless skin. This stuff is amazing!Note: If you are layering over a liquid foundation, make sure the foundation is dry before you apply the mineral veil or it will look cakey. Also, a little goes a long way so don't over do it. Buffing should take 20-30 seconds max. I get the best results with the mineral foundation, then layering mineral veil over it.

I like cleansers that are gentle and don't have a bunch of weird chemicals in them, especially salicylic acid (it always makes me break out). This is a simple bar cleanser that does the job, keeps my face clear and healthy. Unfortunately though, it is a little too drying for long term use.

There is no miracle cream/oil when it comes to preventing stretchmarks. IT IS GENETIC and if you don't understand that then you will be upset with no matter what you buy. I am 34 weeks along and did not get them. Nor did my Mother with her 4 kids. That's how it works people..... for the most part.Why I did love this stuff is cause it still kept the belly itchies away which any preggo mom will tell you can be torture. And if you give into the scratching you will damage your skin. You need something that will hydrate your skin and do it well and all day. I use this in morning after shower and night before bed. RESIST the urge to scratch and get yourself this oil. I found it on GOOP which is a site that Gwenyth Paltrow runs. She used it during her 2 pregnancy's. Like me she is into a natural lifestyle so I gave it a go. Again, if you are looking for a miracle stretch mark oil, you will be let down unless you are like me and just end up getting them. For what it's worth, having worked in the cosmetic industry I can tell you the best way to prevent stretch marks is a slow and steady weight gain that stays within the suggested range of your doctor. ANYONE will get stretch marks if they get too big. Just how it goes!

I have already purchased approximately 8 of those masks and I can honestly say my skin is glowing so much since the first use. As other people mentioned, you don't need to use all of the mask (in my opinion, it's just waste of good material:). It usually stays for 10 days if I use it every night so you can save a money too.

Since I'm a woman, it seems like any time anyone doesn't know what to get me, they resort to body sprays and lotions because all women are supposed to like those, I think. As a result of that, I have years' worth of body sprays sitting around and going bad because I just don't like them. But this one is different.This smells more like the stem and leaves of the tomato plant, so it's an earthy yet refreshing scent. I always get questions and compliments about this spray. I love that it's not flowery or fruity. It's probably not something a super girly-girl would like, but for someone who doesn't like the usual scents, this is perfect.

I first heard about this cologne from a female co-worker. After going to the mall to have a smell (amazing) and jumping online to read some customer reviews, I was sold. To be honest, I was skeptical about ordering online because I had read other reviews of cologne on Amazon stating that the bottle they received was "stale" or "not the same as when [they] smelled in stores." I'm telling you right now, I had no problems with this one.Some men are going to say this cologne isn't masculine enough and it smells like perfume. It definitely smells like perfume when you smell the bottle, but if you actually spray it on, it smells nothing like it. I usually wear Drakkar Noir by Guy Laroche. Just to let you know right now, this scent is the complete opposite. While DN has a strong, masculine spicy seductive tone of smell to it, Chrome has a soft, under the surface, hint of citrus, intoxicating kind of effect. It's like smelling a more gentle side of a man's personality. How sexy can that be? The scent is so soft that you will be tempted to spray more because you think it's not there, but trust me, it's there! This smell works better when I spray on my skin rather than clothing. But then again, you have to find a cologne that works well with your natural scent. For me, this will be number two all-time only behind the Noir. I love getting random whiffs of this cologne throughout the day.Obviously, I tried to stay away from the typical "LADIES LOVE IT" kind of review. If you're a male and the only reason why you're buying this cologne is because "women love it," you should definitely find another cologne that works for you. If you're a female looking for a gift or looking for a scent for her man, look no further. I would recommend Chrome and rate it 9/10 overall (10 for smell, 8 for longevity). It's one of the best colognes I've ever worn.

I like the way this Neutrogena Rainbath felt on my skin, but I wasn't very pleased with the scent. I expected it to be more ""citrusy."" Also, the shape of the bottle makes it difficult to use. It's thinner at the bottom, so it doesn't stand up well in the shower or bathtub. Overall, the product worked well, though, and my skin didn't feel dry after using it.

My beautician gave this to me, (she's a friend of mine) and it worked great for a long time, like a year or more. Then all of a sudden it would quit in the middle of a session of hair doing. It was very frustrating to be straigthening my hair and all of a sudden it would quit, leaving me with half undone hair. So I put it in the drawer and started using my Helen of Troy air brush.I think it thought it was overheating. Then I would go back to it and 30 minutes later, if I chose to use it again, it would work for a few minutes again til it apparently was overheating again. My hair has been dyed a form of blonde for almost 45 years, either by a stylist or myself (although I can't lie ~ perhaps there have been a few oranges (peroxide, no not me!) and a green here or there from pool use...before Naturtint). Therefore, I feel very confident in praising this product. I told my daughter that if I only have one hair left on my head that I wanted it blonde. She of course said she'd pluck it...oh well!On a more serious note, after returning to a salon and requesting her to be sure she did it "just like the last time" so it looked almost like it was streaked with all of the fine variances of color to it and she told me that I create the streaked look, not the stylist as she just uses one color, it's hair type...well let's just say I am no longer spending a fortune to a stylist. So really look at your hair first. And seriously, you mix the two colors, put it on your head, wait 45 minutes, wash it, put the conditioner on for several minutes and you have amazing corn silk hair (that stylists will compliment!). I can't guarantee you will love the color ~ that looks so natural and a gorgeous shade of blonde, because your color will play a heavy role in its outcome, but that from my experience it is an amazing product. My natural hair is fine & a silvery gray or would be if I'd let it alone. I have also used Light Blonde, Golden Blonde and a few others and they are okay but a bit darker than the Honey Blonde (which is my favorite). I've stayed away from anything that inferred beige for fear of a dullness to the appearance. Because my hair is fine I've even used half the bottle so it would last through two uses, but as that requires measuring, and it's not that expensive, why bother, right?Good luck!!

Make sure you know the real color prior to buying the product. It's a really nice neon and you need a top coat to make it shine. However, the color chipped within a day even with a top coat on. I'd rather just buy a different brand that holds up longer.

Am a fair skinned male that HATES to use sun screen. Result, I have had several basal skin cancers removed - messy. Told my dermatologist how much I hate sun screens and she suggested Color Science. Feels strange using a cosmetic brush, my girls laugh, but it really works! Put it on my nose, face and top of ears, spent 8 hours in the sun working - no burn! It is not greasy and you do not feel it! Amazing stuff! Just hope it continues to work. Would be nice to see it drop in price as well!
It is comfortable, but, the skin under the pad was so water logged that I was afraid to continue wearing it.

This used to be one of my favorite fragrances. I received it a few weeks ago, and it smells stronger, not the masculine but soft touch it used to have. Now it smells great but more alcoholic. I called Coty NY (manufacturers), and they told me my bottle was manufactured on december 2010, so it's not expired. Just different. Still love the fragrance though.

This is perfect for the "beach hair" look. Although I struggle with letting my natural waves free, this product helps create the look. While I would not recommend for a serious job interview, it is perfect for the days you want those natural waves to come out and I have not found anything on the market quite as good for relaxed waves.

I have used the Tangle Free Hot Air Bush on my hair for about 10 years. When I fist started using it I had shoulder length hair. now have short hair and it still works great for styling and lift. I keep 2 0n hand at all times. If you travel a lot, it is compact and weighs less than most hair dryers, and for me it curls better than a curling iron. It comes in 2 different sizes for long or short hair.

I purchase this for my Dad. We appreciate the chance to find it at Amazon because it is long since gone from the stores and no longer in the mainstream. However, it is the perfect scent and gift for him. When it is not a gift and he asks for it, he is always pleased that it arrives at his door, the price is very reasonable, and it is the real product. Good purchase and good experience all around.
This soap has a fragrance that is very nice but I found that it is not thick enough for the soap pump.
It is hard to tell after only a month's use of this product but I do think that it has improved my hair growth some. I am going to continue to use it.

I ordered this product through Amazon, so didn't have the benefit of smelling it. I love tropical scents, and this perfume is tropical smelling, but it doesn't smell like Coco-Mango. The strongest scent you pick up is orange blossom, and I "tested" this on a few people and got the same answer. It is a very nice perfume, I just don't like Orange Blossom and felt a little deceived by the name.
I bought this item for my wife, because, I know that it's one of her favorites. The price on Amazon was the best around, and she is very happy with it.

This product did not make my crows feet and frown lines go away, but it did do something I can't quite put my finger on. I know this because during the few days I used it, I had several people at the office tell me I looked tired and run down. I'd never gotten those kind of comments before. I stopped using the Freeze 24/7, and the comments stopped.

At first I did not mind the smell but it seems like as you get to the bottom of the bottle it starts smelling worse. Also the face wash dried out my skin so now it is flaky and feels rough. It did help me get rid of some(not all) of my pimples, so that is why it gets three stars.

i bought the derma wand and returned it without using it because i read a warning from the state of california on the instructions that said that the product could cause cancer and birth defects because of the chemicals it uses....needless to say i wasn't gonna use it! i went to the official derma wand website but i couldn't find any info on that claim or maybe i didn't look hard enough. maybe ill e-mail them one day and see if they tell me anything about that.

I've been using hot rollers for close to 40 years and have never had the trouble I have had with this product.I store my rollers in a drawer and take them out every morning to roll my shoulder length hair. Inevitably when I pick the unit up from the drawer, the plastic top which is not attached, falls off and all the curlers tumble out. Also, the clips seem inadequate for the rollers. The clips are not secure and will work their way off the curler. I have tried using the clips in every position possible because the standard way doesn't hold the roller. However, nothing seems to help and they always pop off one by one to the floor with the roller close behind.The curlers do their job and curl your hair if you have patience with the clips.
this isn't doing it for me. I get 'brighter' results from a mud mask. when its gone, I'm done
Love this color - not too sheer, not too heavy. Perfect for both french manicures and just alone for a clean, pretty look.
This Boss spray has a clean fresh scent that's just wonderful. There's not much more I can say. It's just great -- nothing too overpowering, nothing too flowery. Nice bottle too.

My 6 yr old son has guttate psoriasis. We bought the Body Shops hemp body butter 1st and it worked great at keeping the flair ups and redness down. But the smell is horrible. So the 2nd time we bought this and were super excited because it smelled great. But it lacks the thickness and healing properties of the body shops body butter. It works fantastic for plain old dry skin and hands tho and has a wonderful scent. A sort of banana smell. So I give it 3(ok) for scent and moisturizing, but I believe it doesn't contain enough of the actual hemp healing properties that we were looking for. We will go back to the stinky stuff for that. :)

Highly recommend, especially if your scalp tends to become irritated when using other shampoo's (like Head & Sholders,) then consider trying Dr. Bonners line of Castile soaps. Very efficient cleaning action, with an assortment of various scents, that doesn't leave my scalp sore and itchy. A very small amount is all that is needed so it is actually very inexpensive over the long run. A 64 oz container will last more than a year. Decanting a smaller amount into a smal spray bottle makes it's use very easy, HOWEVER, don't get it in your eyes, this is NOT a none irritating soap! It is however not as bad as some others I have tried. Many people will want to use a conditioner after using it as a shampoo as well. When using it as a hand soap strongly recommend cutting it with tap water, about 1 part soap to 8 parts water, a little goes a LONG way! The label can be an entertaining diversion as well. The producers of Dr. Bonners soap line make considerable effort to keep thier products as enviornment friendly as possible. Check out the web site for more on that if your interested.

I LOVE the product and the color it produces. It's the nearest to my natural color that I have ever found. The brand seems to be as good for my hair as color can be. I've been using this shade for the past few years. However, I cannot find #415 in the stores at all anymore, hence the online purchase. (In fact I have the feeling the entire "100% color" line is gone.)When I received the boxes, the product boxes were in pretty good condition. The crumbles could have been from shipping. What concerned me was that three of the four boxes said "New Shade". Hmmmm... how old is this product? What is the shelf life of hair color?My "bad" that I did not contact the seller immediately with my concerns but I'm in the middle of starting a new job and moving at the same time.It was well past time to "do" my hair so I thought I would try it. The "creme" was hardly a creme. It was almost runny. The good news is that it didn't burn my head or hair so I guess it's ok. I am wondering, though about using the other three boxes. I'm just disappointed that the product is so very old and was not said to be.

My salon charges an extra dollar for this product and though it may dry the top of the enamel it does not dry through all coats 3 hours after my pedicure I needed to put heels on and my pedicure was ruined. My nails were still wet 3 HOURS later How is that a quick dry.

This mascara is really nice, but it smudges like crazy. It comes on really dark and makes your lashes look so full. For the price, I would expect something that doesn't smudge as bad. Would not buy again.
This straightener was great for about a year. Then one day, I plugged it in and one of the plates stopped working.
I like the active ingredients and it works great on cleansing but the scent in the product is way too strong. Very peach and very smelly. I wish they made an unscented version.

I agree with all the one star reviews - this mousse should be placed in the HALL OF SHAME! These awful reviews articulated my feelings after using this awful mousse myself. However, I will make a point to say that literally everything this mousse claims to be is PHONY ADVERTISING! Here's a brief run-down:1. Springing Curls: This name is a joke. At best you get pseudo-curls and they definitely aren't springing (they hang there like limp pieces of spaghetti and look about as appetizing).2. Curl Volumizing: Fat chance. Like I said, there are next to no curls. As for volumizing, I can't phathom how this can be claimed. The hair get clumped together.3. Frizz control: This is laughable. Frizz abounds when using this. And when it's humid out? Forget it - you look like a tumbleweed.4. Medium hold: The overstatement of the millennium! In fact, minimum hold for this mousse would be an overstatement.5. Adds body: The sky will turn green before this happens. If it doesn't volumize, it certainly doesn't add body. The hair has no shape.6.Reduces flyaways: Lies! I've never had more than when I used this.7. Curl enhancing: The biggest lie of them all. This mousse practically reduces curl.There are plenty of other products out there, so I would recommend that you explore them and stay away from this one. It's a disaster from start to finish.
just not enough deodorant power; allows "breakthrough" odor. Jason unscented stick works for me without the "breakthrough" the roll-on allows.

The price was perfect and it sold me on this product. From the very first use, I knew I wouldn't want anything else. It isn't greasy or thick. It soaks perfectly into your skin and guess what? No nasty smell that a lot of other sunscreen lotions have.
Beautiful! My husband loved it! I looked at his old bag and knew it was time for a new one. This fit the bill!

Pros:Good for blush or bronzorCons:ScratchyDidn't retain shape after washingDoesn't deposit enough foundationThis came in the starter kit I got as a gift and it sucks. I only use it for blush, which it actually distributes well. It distributes the power foundation terribly. The only reason why it got a 2 is because it actually got softer after I washed it so it wasn't nearly as scratchy, but it did lose some of its shape: it became more fanned out and less dense.

I purchased the Jean Nate body lotion for nostalgic reasons. Used to be a dime store product so was disappointed to pay so much for such a small bottle. Plus the lotion appeared to have either been used (there was no "new seal" on the opening) or it was on the shelf too long. Bottle wasn't full and it smelled "sour".
Sent the wrong size. I paid for the larger. Tried to rectify. Again, the wrong size. Good communication. Packaging was fine.

I have extremely sensitive skin and almost every product makes me breakout. I have been using Cetaphil Sunblock for years now because it was the only one that my skin didn't react to, but it left my skin oily. I tried this when I received a sample and I just loved it and had to buy it right away. This sunscreen I put on after my Shiseido Oil Reducing regimen and it actually acts as a base under my makeup. It leaves my skin with a matte finish and makes my skin less oily. It's thick, but blends in well and doesn't leave a white film on my face. I even go out without any powder on now. It is extremely water proof though and when you sweat at the gym or get wet in the water it looks a little funny because the water just beads up and stays there. Other then that I highly recommend this product. As for the sun protection I usually tan very easily using sunblock, but I do not get any color when I wear this. I use this on my face, neck and chest.

great curl definition, but didn't really help with my frizz. also didn't do much for shine. i do have a tiny afro and maybe once my hair grows and i can better spread the product through my hair, it will give better results.
The tablets dont seem to do anyting... but the cream is fantastic. It dries up acne in an instant. love it

I have used this nail polish as part of a combination of nail polishes to create the perfect French Manicure that has stopped traffic and gotten compliments galore for over a decade. It's lilac opal, cotton candy, and white opal, put on in that order. One coat each. You add the french manicure white that is used at all salons after you apply the cotton candy and the white opal goes over the whole presentation like a top coat. It's beautiful.
I LIKE THAT YOU DON'T HAVE TO BREAK THIS UP TO PUT IT IN THE PARAFFIN WAX BATH.

I have to say this is a very nice service. I always buy 2 packaeges and they arrive in time and the most important is they arrive safe. I have attention when I ask anything. I think they are very responsable people.About the Rogaine... Is the best. I think it works really. I have two months using it and I have had great results.
I was looking for an extension mirror that was inexpensive & matched my faucets/hardware. This fit the bill perfectly. It was easy to install & the 5x magnification is awesome!
This is an amazing price for this Burberry-London,cologne! My son loves it and at this price ,who can resist! Thanks
great packaging quality. not alot of pigment. i think i need to keep testing it out to see if i really like it though.

I am disappointed that this $8 bar of soap smells no better than any other green soap, and not as good as Irish Spring. I was and am looking for manly smelling soaps that are distinctive, not general in fragrance. I think it is regular overpriced soap. Yes it may last longer but that's only half of what I am looking for. I am currently waiting on a Caswell-Massey sampler and a bar of Mistral Sandalwood... I hope they live up to their pricing.

For quite a while i was dying the bottom longer layers of my hair bright red or pink and the top layers were blond. (I know it sounds weird but it looked really cool) Anyway, I was tired of semi-permanent and i wanted to go forever red but it seems like unnatural hair color doesnt come in permanent! By all means if you can find something affordable to prove me wrong please do! So I finally found this stuff, I got it in fire and...dark red i think and i did the bottom layers dark red and a little further up the fire color which is actually kind of orange and then my blond on top so it made a kind of fireball effect (awesome i know) and it lasted a week and even then there was severe fading. Maybe I misread something on the description but this did not stay on long at all!!! But I do have to say the bottom-est layer was a bit damaged due to bleaching so the color might not have wanted to stay in that hair, but that does not explain why it refused to stay in the layers above that... So my search continues...

I should have bought in the stores, it's cheaper and I wasn't a fan of the soft black. I like very black, thick lashes so this is only a good fit for someone wanting to do a simple daytime look. The mascara doesn't stay on long and my lashes feel oily with it on.

I started using this lotion when I was a teenager, and it has totally ruined me for any other lotions. They all feel so watery and thin to me. I bought this chi thinking it was real it looks real but i have the real deal sitting here just broke down after useing 3years this man i emailed him first and asked him because of all the fake chi irons i was hearing about i wanted to make surethat it was real his remark to me was i should shop with confidence so i thought ok i will ..I got it .it looked real it really didlook 100 percent legit,but it wasnt ..Heres a few things that i noticed when i picked it up to use it its way lighter then the real chithats number 1 red flag number 2 i turned it on the light its not flat like the real chi its like a bubble and the way it blinks if u everhad a chi u know how it flickers letting u know its ready it flickers it doesnt just come on and off but 3thr biggest thing us ladys notice is performenceso i went to straighten my hair with it now with the real chi it grips ur hair it pulls its even in order for the perfect straightening well lets justsay when u use the fake chi it doesnt grip it doesnt even grasp ur hair ur hair slips through it causeing ur hair to not get straighten righti gripped it as hard as i could and still it would not tighten FAKE my real chi that is right here with me its way heavyier built way betterit lasted me 3 years and now the one i bought a hugeee disapointment ..i should have known by the 52 doller price tag is what i payed for itbut i thought i was getting a deal lol one deal of a rip off Amazon is now looking into this and so are my lawyers so to u long nikar ripping people offmaybe u will think twice.....

I have had eczema for 20 years and used so many lotions and creams and changed my soaps and nothing ever worked.. Well finally was told to try this lotion out and in less than a month a gt major results.. My skin is always smooth and looks amazingly healthy.. I can't get enough of this..

I just picked this up today and have been wearing it all day - so far I love it. It's a little bit musky and a little bit fruity, and it also has a sort of powdery scent to it - very light and clean and feminine, which I think will be great to wear to the office.

Well, I love everything about this hair dryer except for the buttons... too difficult to slide back and forth with one hand while drying my hair. If my hands are perfectly dry and have absolutely NO hair product on them, then the buttons are not a problem. Unfortunately, before drying my hair I always put some type of product in it.. a smoothing cream or gel of some sort. Usually I just rub the remaining product into my hands, as those that I use are great for dry skin.... though they take a while to fully absorb, leaving my hands a bit slippery.... which makes it very difficult to slide the buttons back and forth. I have to stop, put my round brush down and use both hands so I can use a fingernail to move the buttons. This might sound petty, but my hair takes forever to dry as it is, and I do like to change the speed and temperature quite a bit while I am drying my hair. Constantly having to put my brush down so I can use my nails to move the buttons is a hassle.I have used many hair dryers over the years, and have never had this particular problem before. As mentioned, I like the benefits of rubbing the excess hair product into the skin on my hands, and would rather not wash it off before drying my hair. Even if I DO wash right away though, since the hair products are usually thick and slippery, it takes several washes to remove all traces so my fingers don't just slide over the buttons. So, for now I try to avoid having to change the dryer settings as much as usual... and when I do, I just have to keep setting my brush down so I can use both hands for the 'moving of the buttons'. I will definitely look for another dryer when it is time to replace this one... of course, now that I am actually wanting to replace a dryer, this one will probably last forever(;

I bought this to help with fungal folliculitus I think I got from the hot tub. I have been using for several months, along with Nizorel anti-fungal shampoo, and now use it as my regular soap when showering.It has a pleasant, but not overpowering, smell and seems to dry my skin out quite well, which is good for me, as I have generally very oily skin and am also prone to spots on my back and shoulders.Definitely worth a try.

I bought this to wear under a ball cap at work. I usually have to wash my ball cap at least once a week here in Phoenix and they end up losing their shape and I have to replace them. This prevents all that, my last new ball cap still looks new after two months. It flat out works!
I really like this perfume's scent, however it doesn"t last very long. Went with the parfum as opposed to the eu de toilette thinking it would be better.
I got this product this week alongwith the night cream and the eye contour cream and i must say they are working great so far. Its a must try product esp if you have normal/conbimation skin.
I was swayed by the great reviews. I wouldn't purchase again. There must be some trick to using it because I can not get as good a shave as with Lab Series or Headslick.

I had one of these for 5 years and it was broken on a trip in my luggage which I understand the way they handle our luggage. So that is why I purchase this a month ago. This weekend doing my hair it got caught on a knot and the whole thing snapped...very cheaply made. Very upset. Have to find another like this.

This product worked great on my face but on my neck line I still have break outs. I have tried the product for a little over two weeks and have not had any new breakouts on my face. But my jaw and neck are still very bad. I am glad I tried it but I don't think I will be buying it in the future.

So, I'm over 38 (cough-cough) but not by much. And I've got a pink girly crush on Pink Sugar Hair Perfume. I have tons of long, thick, wavy hair and a few innocent squirts of this stuff at 8am I can still smell it at 5pm!Yummy, per the male co-workers, fwiw... I don't wear it for attention. I like smelling nice. Worth a few bucks to feel indulgent in a world where that's reserved for football players and such...
Im not sure why I thought it really would plump your lips but it doesn't. It's just a nice lip gloss, similar to the inexpensive ones at the drug store.

I purchased this product because I am 9 months pregnant and have been taking warm baths at night to help soothe aches and pains, and to help me sleep. The pillow is larger than I anticipated, which is wonderful. I have had it for almost four weeks and have noticed no air leaks. It dries fairly quickly. The fabric on the front is soft, not itchy. The suction cups work well enough. If I begine sliding in the bathtub the pillow slides down as well, but that is to be expected; however, the pillow does stay stuck to the tub.I would recommend this product!
Originally thought it was a fast heating set of rollers like others I've had; it wasn't but works fine if you don't mind waiting a while for the rollers to heat up.

I bought a bottle of Farah in the spring and used it once. It's now August and I opened it again and it's thick and syrupy - as if its been sitting around for years. Application was sticky and awful. It bubbled when it dried. I'm disappointed Zoya, because you do make a lot of fantastic colors, but there are lots of other companies out there doing safer polishes in just as many fun colors...Butter London, Anthropologie, Deborah Lippman, Essie...we have more choices now so I'm officially off the zoya bandwagon.

I purchased this cream as a result of the commercial on television and had great hope it might work. However, it doesn't. I went back to using my Oil of Olay which I have used for years and years. I have also used a few of the other Retinol creams which also DO NOT work.....not worth the expense.

I had expected a completely plastic item and was not expecting a cloth cover to the item. I wonder if the description is not complete enough. One of the reviews I read led me to believe it was all plastic. Otherwise it's OK.
Item was right product, in perfect condition, and packaged properly but the coverage doesn't seem to be as good. Possibly B.E. has changed their formula since my last purchase.

I have back pain and foot pain so I thought, after watching the infomercial, that this was just what I needed after hearing all the testimonials. I liked the fact that the heal was low, kind of like the Earth shoe of the 70's. But they neglected to tell you that the arches were not flexible but very hard plastic. The arches hurt like hell and I used the lowest one (they provide three different heights of arches.). Also, it took forever for them to get here. Almost a month! (I ordered from the Walkfit company, not Amazon.) I paid $10 shipping. What were they using? Pony Express? Anyhow, when I called the company about the pain, (I couldn't walk with them more than a few minutes) they told me I would have to get used to them but if I have foot problems I may never get used to them. WHAT??? The infomercial targets people WITH foot problems providing a list of various ailments such as heel spurs etc. Anyhow, I tried again and then the next day and so on for a few weeks. I really wanted them to work for me. Just hurt so bad I had to return them. After returning them, I had to call the company because the refund was also taking forever. When I called them about not receiving my refund (which was two weeks after they got the package according to my tracking number) they said they didn't put the refund through yet. A month later, I still did not receive the refund. I did eventually get the refund but had to call them three times. Crappy way to do business.Anyhow, this is not the product that I expected, especially since they target people who are having problems walking but the product made it even harder to walk and painful.

I purchased this product for my daughter and was very disappointed with the results. Her hair grew at the same rate as it normally would. It was a waste of time and money. Taking 10 pills a day and not seeing any results is frustrating.
Hubby says this headband works better than many others he has purchased. We don't know what in the product makes it work, but it absorbs water and does the job!

I bought this shampoo for my thin hair. Smell was pleasant, product was fine, but I don't think I'd buy it again as it didn't transform or change my hair in any way. I prefer Redmon's organic and cruelty free shampoo and conditioners.

This is no good at all. Streaks and uneven paint. As much as I tried to make this look good it would just not do it. I have been doing my own nails for years so I know a good product. It's is cheap, poorly made nail polish. It makes your nails look like you painted them with pink chalk. Do not buy this.

was very disappointed in this scent. Smells like that old woman's perfume (you know that one that sits right in front of you at church). I couldn't wash it off fast enough. Went back to make sur the box said "For Men" and it did. I guess I am one of the few who hated it but definitely test it before buying online and believeing the reviews. Live and learn I guess.
I'm a huge Tiffany's fan (and Breakfast at Tiffany's) and just had to have For Audrey. It is a beautiful match to the iconic Tiffany's shade and lasts well on the nail without chipping.

I have not tried the item because I am afraid to...the smell is so so strong. I have been wearing lace wigs for 1yr now and I like to try out new tapes and glues. I recently met this guy who was wearing a Tupae(sp?) and his head did smell strong but I figured it was just that brand. Well I guess I stumbled on to the exact brand he uses cause it smell the same. perhaps I have a sensitive sense of smell? (I dont think so) but its so strong it could make me dizzy. I am not one for wasting money but I'm not sure If I can give this one a try (Mmm...maybe at the nape of my neck?) Does anyone know if the smells goes away? WOW. STRONG

My current results with Teamine are scary and upsetting. . .I am praying my skin will recover. I am 52 and had minimal wrinkles but very dark circles under my eyes. After using Teamine for several weeks I noticed my under eye skin was becoming super crepey, saggy, and new deep wrinkles were developing. At first I thought, unfortunately, I was just developing some aging skin and absolutely felt sick about it. But soon it became obvious, NOBODY ages that FAST in a course of THREE weeks!! I could not believe a product that was supposed to do just the OPPOSITE could be causing this, but IT DID! Now I am desperately trying to hydrate my skin, as was suggested in someones else's review, and hoping to at least get it back to how it was before.I had skimmed the negative reviews before purchasing but still wanted to try it because my dermatologist had recommended it. Also, I use the Revision Nectafirm and I really do love that, so I trusted Teamine would be at least safe to try! I feel differently now, Teamine needs to have a warning regarding the damage it can cause.Be warned if you have aging skin!! It may cause crepey, dried out, saggy skin, bags, and deep wrinkles under your eyes. And, unfortunately, it did absolutely nothing for my under eye circles. In fact, they started to look ruddy red! If you are young and have tight skin but dark circles, you may be safe. But, in my opinion, Teamine is not worth the risk on aging skin! Good luck, all.
This soap is wonderful...no chemicals and no parabens...which you find in many other "health-natural" brands. Peppermint is very invigorating...it's my favorite.

I am a routine tanned and purchased this product in hopes of getting a darker tan because it is a 'tingle' lotion. I was disappointed that it barely made me tingle and I didnt notice a big difference in color

I ordered this and the barrel was not rotating. So returned it and ordered another one. and this one is not rotating either . Am I missing something here or both are broken ?New update : supposedly the barrel is not supposed to rotate. But the description says rotating barrel.

I found this lipstick mentioned on Remodelista. It was a true red, a hard color to find. I was delighted to find it on Amazon and bought it right away. The color will always be in my lipstick collection. My pal from babyhood who now lives in Wisconsin bought it, too.
unfortunately the sun block gave my 19 month old a rash wherever I used the product. She is very fair and must have super sensitive skin. I've asked for a refund, but got no response as of yet.

I tried this cleanser when it first came out and immediately noticed that it is different. After using the first bottle up I have never let my self run out.This product does what it claims, period. I just don't get break outs. It minimizes the look of enlarged pores and it prevents clogged pores from turning into zits because it has two chemicals to sweep out the gunk. My skin feels clean without feeling tight or squeeky. I have normal skin and it doesn't over dry.The texture is something between soapy and creamy with tiny smooth grains in it. It took a little getting used to because it doesn't really foam up, maybe like ten percent. Don't let that confuse you though, most cleansers ADD a chemical who's sole purpose is to foam, because the customer expects it!Also, It has more of a clinical odor than a perfumed scent, but that makes sense since it's technically medicated product to resolve acne. I typically don't want anything extra in products I put on my face anyway, so as far as I'm concerned I'm glad they don't heavily perfume to cover the medicinal scent.A couple people mentioned stinging in the eyes: The packaging does indicate you should not get it in your eyes. This product contains Alpha Hydroxy Acid - any acid would hurt in the eyes! The alpha hydroxy acid is a heavy duty hitter, that's what you are paying for! If I have eyeliner and mascara on, then I use the Neutrogena eye makeup remover first, then wash my face as normal.I love this product so much I will probably use it forever. It is a performance product, it has just what you need to clean out your pores. It's a good daily cleanser that will have people complementing your skin in no time flat.
This product seems to make my skin feel less dry, but I haven't seen much improvement in terms of wrinkles.

I love this color. After getting a manicure withSinful Colors Professional Nail Polish Enamel 56 Neon MelonI bought this China Glaze polish to try to replicate it. Even at the nail salon they had to do four coats to get the China Glaze color to look nice. That's a lot of work. The Sinful Colors brand that they used last time only took 3 coats and I kind of liked it better. But either way it's awesome and I get tons of compliments on it!

My mom got me this hair dryer over a year ago and it works pretty good. I have long thick hair and this seems to dry my hair fairly quickly. It doesn't have as much power as my old Rusk Speed Freak, which stopped working for me after a few years of use, but this dryer works well enough. One complaint is that when the concentrator nozzle is on my hair gets caught between the nozzle and the hair dryer. I am happy enough with this product but I don't think I'd buy it again to be honest.
